Now in its eleventh loan cycle the group begins to understand the program. They have been living in the same village for several decades and maintain relationships of solidarity and mutual aid. They are active at small retail trade.

46-year-old Mrs. Ansatou (standing at the far right with her hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is married and has six children including three girls and three boys. She is active at selling clothing, palm oil and catering (selling breakfasts).

With the new loan she intends to buy women's clothing worth 121,000 francs for resale in the sub-region, and 10 bottles of palm oil at 17,500 francs a bottle, to be resold at retail prices.

In addition to improving her family's living conditions, the profits will enable her to support her children with schooling, medical care and clothing.

loans.use: buy women's clothing worth 121,000 francs for resale in the subregion, and 10 bottles of palm oil bottles at 17,500 francs a bottle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his laundry room and bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Luz Merys

texts.es:
Ver trabajar a Luz es un gran privilegio una mujer cabeza de familia dedicada al mundo de la agricultura quien tiene un hijo de 8 años y que de momento se encuentra en embarazo y que a pesar de que debe guardar reposo se levanta diariamente a dar la ronda matutina de sus tierras, regando abono y fumigantes para proteger sus cultivos.

Luz es madre de un pequeño de 8 años de edad, ella sueña con ser una madre ejemplar, enseñar a sus hijos la importancia del campo, pagar su educación y que tengan un alimento digno en su casa.

Pensando mejorar, ampliar sus terrenos, preparar y dejar el negocio listo para el nuevo miembro de la familia que se avecina, Luz quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en insumos para la preparación del terreno, como semillas, abonos y construir un  canal de riegos.
texts.en:
Watching Luz work is a great privilege. She is the head of her family, works in agriculture and has an eight-year-old child. At the moment, she is pregnant and although she should be resting, she gets up every morning to do a tour of her land, spreading fertilisers and fumigants to protect her crops. 

Luz is the mother of an eight-year-old child and her dream is to be a model mother, to teach her children the importance of the fields, pay for their education and to have decent food for them in her house.

With the idea of improving, extending her land, preparing and leaving the business ready for the new family member who will soon arrive, Luz is requesting a loan that she will invest in consumables to prepare her land, such as seeds and fertilisers. She also wants to build an irrigation channel.

loans.use: to buy consumables for preparing her land (seeds, fertiliser)

loans.name: Graca

texts.pt:
A Sra. Graça, tem 35 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 1 filho menor de idade. Para além do seu filho, vive com a sua cunhada que frequenta o ensino primário. Vive na casa própria que ainda está em construção, com o empréstimo, pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: chapa de zinco, cimento, blocos e portas para dar a continuidade da sua obra.
Ela tem o sonho de concluir os seus estudos (licenciatura) e posterior mestrado. O seu principal desafio é o reembolso de empréstimo para poder contrair o outro.
texts.en:
Graça is 35 years old, married and a mother to a young son. As well as her son, Graça also lives with her sister in law who goes to primary school. She lives in her own home which is still under construction. With this loan, she intends to buy building materials, namely tin sheets, cement, blocks and doors to continue her renovations.

Graça's dream is to finish her studies (bachelor degree) and later go on to a master's degree. Her main challenge is to repay this loan so she can take out another one.

loans.use: to buy tin sheets, cement, blocks and doors to continue her renovations.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane distrito de Inharrime tem 43 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É Técnico Agrónomo a mais de 11 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois sendo proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de material electrónico como: lâmpadas, tomadas, fios, interruptores e mais. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende tornar se num agente económico de renome ao nível do distrito. O seu maior desafio é expandi r mais no negócio.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur was born in Inhambane in the district of Inharrime. He is 43 years old, lives with his wife and is a father to four young children, all of whom go to school. He is not responsible for anyone else. 

He has been a technical agronomist for more than 11 years where he earns a living that covers the household costs. As the owner of a commercial establishment he is applying for a loan to increase the amount of stock that he sells, namely electronic equipment such as lights, outlets, cables, switches, and more. This will be his seventh loan with Hluvuku.

In the future he would like to become a renowned finance agent in his district. His greatest challenge is further expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy lights, outlets, cables and switches

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
A Sra. Celeste, tem 32 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 4 filhos que frenquentam o ensino secundário e primário, respectivamente. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta a sua sobrinha que também estuda.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar cervejas de diversas marcas, amendoim, arroz, feijão para revender. Para além de vender produtos da mercearia, confecciona refeições para trabalhadores de empresas em redor da sua mercearia.
Ela tem o sonho de prosperar no seu negócio, pese embora, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras e o seu desafio é redobrar as esforças para poder reembolsar o empréstimo
texts.en:
Celeste is 32 years old, single and a mother to four children who go to high school or primary school, respectively. As well as her children, Celeste supports her neice who is also studying.

With this loan Celeste would like to buy different brands of beer, peanuts, rice and beans to resell. In addition to selling groceries, she also makes refreshments for the company workers around her grocery store.

Celeste dreams of creating a prosperous business in spite of the fact that she is facing financial difficulties. Her challenge is to double her efforts to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy different brands of beer, peanuts, rice and beans to resell

loans.name: Jaqueline Iveth

texts.es: Jaqueline de 29 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 9 y 15 años de edad en la vivienda de su propiedad desde hace 3 años. Hace 4 años Jaqueline a base de esfuerzo y sacrificio logro establecer un pequeño negocio en la escuela de su localidad en el cual vende productos de uso escolar como papelería  y obras literarias además cuenta con máquinas copiadoras he impresoras, gracias a lo que logra tener mejores ingresos. Jaqueline ha observado que su pequeño local ya necesita algunas reparaciones, además desea ampliar su oferta de productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en materiales para reparar el material y productos de papelería para su negocio. Anteriormente Jaqueline se apoyó en un crédito con el cual instalo energía eléctrica en su vivienda, por lo que se siente feliz y agradecida y espera poder contar el apoyo de un nuevo crédito para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: 29-year-old Jaqueline is an enterprising woman who lives with her husband and her two daughters, aged 9 and 15, in the home she has owned for the last three years. Four years ago, with a lot of effort and sacrifice, Jaqueline managed to set up a small business at the local school where she sells school supplies, such as stationery and books. She also has photocopiers and printers, which results in higher earnings for her. Jaqueline has observed that her small store needs some repairs. She also wants to expand her product offering. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in materials for making repairs and to buy stationery products for her business. Jaqueline’s previous loan helped her to install electricity in her home, for which she is very grateful, and she hopes to be able to have the support of another loan so she can continue improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in materials for making repairs and to buy stationery products for her business

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Hortencia, tem 33 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam o ensino primário. Para além dos seus filhos, vive com a sua sobrinha que trabalha.
Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar material de construção: chapa de zinco, cimento, blocos, varrões, carrada de area, pedra para aumentar a sua casa.
Ela tem o sonho de melhorar as condições de habitação e da dieta alimentar. Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 33 years old, married and a mother to two children who go to primary school. As well as her two children, Hortencia lives with her niece who works. 

With this loan Hortencia would like to buy building materials: tin sheeting, cement, blocks, metal bars, a load of sand and stones to expand her house. 
Hortencia's dream is to improve her living conditions and the food she eats. In spite of facing financial difficulties, her challenge is to repay her loan within the agreed term.

loans.use: to buy building materials: tin sheeting, cement, blocks, metal bars and a load of sand

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants (03 garçons et 03 filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente d’huile raffinée. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de la zone pour le revendre dans son quartier.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 06 bidons de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 15000f la bouteille pour le revendre à 18000f la bouteille.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie (habillements et scolarités des enfants).
texts.en:
This group was created in the second half of 2013. It is made up of women who aspire to work together. They share common values of solidarity and mutual support, based on a long history of living in the same village. In every case, their main activity is trading on a small scale.
Mariame (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of six children (three boys and three girls). Her business is selling refined oil. She buys her supplies in the local markets to resell in her neighbourhood. With this loan, she plans to buy six 20 litre containers of refined oil for 15,000f each, to resell them at 18,000f each.
The resulting profit will enable her to improve the family's living conditions (clothing, and the children's schooling).

loans.use: to buy large cans of refined oil for resale.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 08 enfants (04 garçons et 04 filles). Elle  s’active dans le commerce de légumes et de condiments. Elle achète cette marchandise au marché hebdomadaire communal et même parfois dans les marchés hebdomadaires de villages d’un pays frontalier pour les revendre en détails chez elle. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir effectué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 04 bidons de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 15000f la bouteille, des condiments et légumes  à une valeur de 40 000f.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des frais de scolarité des enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
This group was created in the second half of 2013. It is made up of women who aspire to work together. They share common values of solidarity and mutual support, based on a long history of living in the same village. In every case, their main activity is trading on a small scale.
Fatoumata (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of eight children (four boys and four girls). Her business is trading vegetables and condiments. She buys her merchandise in the weekly local market, and also occasionally at the weekly markets in villages on the border of a neighbouring country - to resell in small quantities from her home. She has a lot of experience in this business, having been involved for several years. With this loan, she plans to buy four 20 litre containers of refined oil for 15,000f each, as well as condiments and vegetables worth 40,000f.
The resulting profit will enable her to help her husband with the childrens' schooling costs, and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four containers of refined oil, and condiments and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor De Yukyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité  Flor de Yukyry esta en el ciclo 4to ciclo, ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando cada día su situación de vida. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Helem es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene una peluquería, que pudo ir montando con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha para poder crecer y salir adelante, y es por eso que pone lo mejor de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, de manera a poder seguir teniendo los productos que necesita para poder seguir con la buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Flor de Yukyry committee is in its 4th cycle. They are putting their best effort into improving their life situation every day. They are very hard working women who are fighters and who want to help their loved ones. 

Helem is one if the members of this group. She has a hair salon that she was able to open with a lot of sacrifice and hard work. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who fights every day to grow and get ahead. That is why she gives the best of herself to be able to improve her living conditions.  

She is asking for this loan to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and more, so that she can keep having the products she needs to continue giving her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and more.

loans.name: Yeny Rosibel

texts.es:
Yeny, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y cuida de sus hijos. 

Yeny, desde hace un tiempo trabaja con una señora que le paga, para que ella salga a la calle a verder cuajada; pero además ella siembra maiz, para el sustento de su familia.

Ella está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, para empezar a prepara la tierra para sembrar maíz, ya que pronto llegará el invierno.

El sueño de Yeny, es que sus tres hijos crezcan sanos y se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Yeny is 24 years old. She went to school up to the second grade. She is married and cares for her children. 

For some time, Yeny has worked for a woman who pays her to go out and sell cheese curd on the street, but she also grows corn to support her family. 

She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials to start preparing the soil to plant corn, because winter is coming soon.

Yeny's dream is for her three children to grow up healthy and graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to start preparing the soil to plant corn.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants (04 garçons et 02filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente d’huile raffinée et de sucre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de la zone pour le revendre dans son quartier.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 03 bidons de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 17000f la bouteille et 01 sac de sucre à 15000f  pour le revendre en détail.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront appuyer ses enfants dans les charges familiales (achats de matériaux de culture.)
texts.en:
This group was created in the second half of 2013. It is made up of women who aspire to work together. They share common values of solidarity and mutual support, based on a long history of living in the same village. Their main activity is trading on a small scale.
Ramatoulaye (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of six children (four boys and two girls). Her business is selling refined oil and sugar. She buys her supplies in the local markets to resell in her neighbourhood. With this loan, she plans to buy three 20 litre containers of refined oil for 17,000f each, and one sack of sugar for 15,000f - to resell in smaller quantities.
The resulting profit will enable her to support her children with the family's expenses (buying cultural material).

loans.use: to buy refined oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja trabaja como mesera en un restaurante en la playa las tunas y tiene una hija. 

José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace dos años, también cría pollos para vender, cuida dos vacas y trabaja en la agricultura.

José, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar comida para los animales y construir un chiquero para sus cerdos. 

Su sueño es, dedicarse al destazo de cerdos y reces, además desea ver crecer a su hija y que se convierta en una profesional.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old. He went to school up to the ninth grade. He is married and his spouse works as a waitress in a restaurant at the Las Tunas beach, and he has a daughter. 

José has raised pigs for two years. He also raises chickens to sell. He cares for two cows and works in agriculture.  

José is asking for the loan to buy feed for the animals and to build a sty for his pigs. 

His dream is work as a butcher of pigs and cows and he also wants to see his daughter grow up and graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy feed for the animals and build a sty for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vaccines, corn, concentrated feed, and other products he needs to increase the productivity of his chicken farm.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Desiree is 37 years old and all of her children are sent to school.

Desiree has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Desiree requested a 16,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

Desiree has been in this business for five years. In the future, Desiree would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 2 años instalo una tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda en la que se apoya para sostener la economía de su hogar, además cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida que se dedica a la elaboración de productos de madera como: camas, roperos, módulos, gaveteros, etc. Ana vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 10 años de edad en vivienda  de su propiedad desde hace algunos años. Anteriormente Ana solicito un crédito a la institución el cual invirtió en la compra de una refrigeradora que utiliza para guardar productos de su negocio, por lo que de nueva cuenta solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual desea invertir en un vehículo que utilizara para transportar productos de su tienda y de la carpintería de su compañero de vida, por lo que sabe que logrará cumplir con las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising woman. She opened a grocery store at home two years ago, which is how she supports her family. Her life partner helps her. He works making wooden products, such as beds, closets, shelves, and cabinets. Ana owns a house where she has been living with her life partner and their 10-year-old son for a couple of years.

Ana used the previous loan from the institution to buy a fridge to store the products she sells. She is now requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy a vehicle to transport her and her life partner’s products. She knows she will be able to pay the installments of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport her and her life partner's products.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
María, de 68 años de edad, está soltera y vive sola, no estudio y sus hijos viven en Estados Unidos, sus hijos la mantienen.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar arena, cemento entre otros para mejorar su vivienda, porque está en mal estado y necesita comprar los materiales para la construcción.
 
El sueño de María es tener una mejor vivienda y vivir en mejores condiciones los ultimos días de su vida.
texts.en:
María, aged 68, is single and lives alone. She did not go to school, and is supported by her children, who live in the United States.

María needs this loan to buy sand, cement and other construction materials to make improvements to her home as it is in a bad condition.

María's dream is to have a better home, and to see out the rest of her days better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement etc. to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Diatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en juin 2008 regroupe des membres qui habitent la même ville et sont solidairement responsables du remboursement de leur crédit. 

Ndéye qui se trouve à gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 45 ans et mére de 02 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de diverses marchandises telles que les chaussures,les vêtements,les draps et l'encens.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit octroyé et son apport personnel:des chaussures pour une valeur de 600000f,des vêtements pour une somme de 700000f,des draps pour 200000f et l'encens pour 100000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et aider son mari à supporter les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group, created in June 2008, unites members who live in the same town who are jointly responsible for paying back their loan.

Ndéye who is on the left of the photo with her arm raised, is the one responsible for the group.  She is 45 and married with two children.

Her business is the trading of various merchandise such as shoes, clothes, bed sheets and incense.

With the loan and her personal contribution she plans to buy: shoes to a value of 600 000f, clothes to the sum of 700 000f, sheets for 200 000f and incense for 100 000f.

Her aim is to increase her savings and to help her husband with the family bills.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start important work on her home, to improve the conditions of her bathroom facilities.

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc De Quellouno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC DE QUELLOUNO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina ella es conviviente y tiene 57 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Señor de Torrechayoc de Quellouno". This bank is situated in the Quellouno district, part of the La Convencion Province and the department of Cusco. 

Segundina is a member, she is aged 57 and has a partner and two children. She earns a living selling fruit, she has land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges, working from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has been doing this job for several years, and it is going well, her dream for the business is to expand the her land for growing. Segundina is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The other members have businesses selling animals, farming, selling groceries, or restaurants.

Segundina is thankful to those who are part of her dream in this way, and promises to fulfill the payments in time with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools to make metal structures.

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
El Sr. Héctor,  es casado, y tiene un hijo, es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, él se dedica a la compra-venta de carbón, desde hace ya 15 años.
Comenta que le está yendo muy bien y que gracias a su esfuerzo está dando a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder dar a su familia todo lo que el no pudo tener.
texts.en: Hector is married and has a child. He is from the city Villa Elisa, and he has worked buying and selling charcoal for fifteen years. He remarks that it is going very well, and thanks to his hard work he is able to provide for his family so they do not want for anything. He is requesting this loan so he can buy charcoal in quantity, and continue with his sales as he has been doing. He is thankful for the opportunity he is given to be able to give his family everything he could not have.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in quantity for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, clams, and lobsters to sell.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: 34 летняя женщина района Мехринисо. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Ее муж занимается ремонтом дома. Мехринисо работает уборщицей в школе, и свободное время выращивает скота. Она покупает скота, и откармливает  30-40 дней, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ей в работе помогает муж и дети. Это деятельность ее отца. Мехринисо сейчас продвигает деятельность отца уже 3 года. Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить доход. Мехринисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести скота. Она старается, чтобы не потерять ежемесячный доход и обеспечить семью.
texts.en: Mehriniso is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. Her husband works in home renovation. Mehriniso works as a school cleaner, and in her spare time she rears livestock. She buys livestock and fattens it for 30-40 days, then resells it at the livestock market. Her husband and children help her in her work. This is her father's business. Mehriniso has been advancing her father's business for the last three years. She has decided to expand the business and increase her income. Mehriniso has applied for a loan to buy livestock. She is trying not to lose her monthly income and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her business.

loans.name: Marlene Lissette

texts.es:
Marlene, es madre de dos hijos, ella es la responsable de cubrir todas las necesidades que surjan en su hogar y para poder hacerlo se dedica a vender ropa, no tiene un horario fijo para desempeñar sus actividades, las ventajas de su negocio son que la mercadería la vende a un precio adecuado en el mercado y la desventaja es no saber asignarle un precio considerable al producto.
Comprará nuevas prendas de vestir en diversos estilos, colores y tallas para surtir mejor su negocio, espera que con la inversión pueda generar nuevos ingresos y un riesgo sería no saber administrar su negocio.
Sus proyectos son ampliar su negocio y tener un local estable para atender a sus clientes así como también mantener el apoyo constante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlene is the mother of two children, she is responsible for covering all of the necessary expenses at home, and in order to do that she sells clothing. She does not have a fixed work schedule. The advantages of her business is she sells the merchandise at an adequate price in the market, and the disadvantage is not know how to assign a considerable price for the product. 
She will purchase new articles of clothing in various styles, colors and sizes to better stock her business. She hopes that with this investment she can generate new income, and a risk would be not knowing how to manage her business. her goals are to expand her business and have a fixed location to attend to her customers, and also to always support her children.

loans.use: to buy new articles of clothing in different styles, colors and sizes to better stock her business.

loans.name: Aksana

texts.ru: Аксана, 18 лет, не замужем, детей нет, живет с бабушкой и дедушкой. Она ведет собственное хозяйство в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи. Благодаря упорному труду Аксаны, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 13 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аксана обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Аксана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aksana is 18 years old, unmarried and without children. She lives with her grandmother and grandfather. She runs her own small farm to get income for her family. Thanks to Aksana's hard work, today she has three cows and 13 sheep. The monthly income is about 16,500 som (KGS). In order to further expand her business, Aksana has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) in order to increase the headcount of her herd. Aksana plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing her number of domesticated livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad vive junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años. Con su venta de tortillas María está logrando sacar adelante a su hijo como madre soltera, ya que actualmente no cuenta con el apoyo del padre, además para obtener mejores ingresos económicos presta sus servicios domésticos los fines de semana. María desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que este es de tierra, lo que está causando enfermedades respiratorias a su hijo y a ella, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. For the past several years she has lived in her own home with her 12 year-old son. As a single mother, Maria has been able to help her son get ahead by selling tortillas. She currently does not get support from his father. 

In addition, in order to make more income, she offers her services as a housekeeper on the weekends. Maria wishes to cover the floor of her home with cement, since it is dirt at present.  The dirt floor is causing her son and her to have respiratory illnesses, and for this reason she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to  invest in cement, sand and gravel in order to cover the floor in her home with cement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cover the floor of her home in cement.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to purchase more meat products and frozen foods. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenses.

Merlinda is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 50,000 PHP loan. This new loan will be used to purchase additional fresh meat products, frozen products and also vegetables, which she now offers as her additional item. By offering more items for sale, her customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Merlinda to sustain her family's needs.

Merlinda dreams to see her business thrive more, as well as give her children a good life in the future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fresh meat, frozen foods and veggies to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 42 years old and living at Solana with her family. She is managing a store and a vulcanizing shop for income. She manages it well to gain good profits. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and soap to sell. This will help improve the capacity of sales in her business. Additional revenue gain will also be used for maintenance of the vulcanizing shop.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: laminate, wood, nails, and wire to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Armenia

texts.en:
Armenia is 36 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Armenia works very hard to provide for them.

Armenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Armenia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Armenia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dorotea is 52 years old, and four of her children are still in school.

Dorotea has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional cloth, thread and yarn, and pay for maintenance for her sewing machine.

Dorotea has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, thread and yarn, and pay for maintenance for her sewing machine

loans.name: Glecilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Glecilda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Glecilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her stall for her business.

Glecilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her stall

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children presently in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, spices, soft drinks, eggs, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, spices, soft drinks, eggs, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle works hard to support her family. Anabelle is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Anabelle requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional cloth, yarn, thread and other material for her business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 35 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, yarn, thread and other material for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and has two children. Gloria is married, and one of her children is in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gloria has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 56 years old and married with five children.

Erlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlina has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Erlina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Naty is a 46-yeer-old married woman with four children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Naty has had a general store business for 2 years and requests 12,000 loan PHP through NWTF to purchase  canned goods, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Naty would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Sandra, tiene una venta de ropa y refrescos en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, vive con su esposo, sus hijos y una tía, su familia está integrada por 6 personas, tienen actividades económicas diferentes, es un oficio que aprendió con ayuda de su tía, comenta que es como una herencia familiar, trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde, su rubro más fuerte es la venta de ropa.
El capital que está solicitando lo utilizará para comprar blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, etc., para surtir el inventario que ofrece a sus clientes,  espera que está inversión le permita contar con clientes satisfechos, nuevos ingresos y los riesgos para Sandra es no vender la mercadería en un tiempo prudencial.
Sus aspiraciones son tener una economía familiar más estable y crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra has a business selling clothes and refreshments in the city municipal market. She lives with her husband, her children and an aunt. There are 6 people in her family, and they all engage in different economic activities. 

Hers is an occupation that she learned with the help of her aunt; it is something of a family heritage. She works from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon, and her main vocation is selling clothing.

She will use the money she is requesting to buy blouses, pants, dresses, shirts etc. to stock the inventory that she offers to her customers.  She hopes that this investment will allow her to have satisfied customers and generate new income. The risk is that she won’t be able to sell her merchandise in a reasonable amount of time. She hopes to have a more stable family financial situation and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, shirts etc. to stock the inventory that she offers to her customers.

loans.name: Phirom's Group

texts.en:
The members of Phirom’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. 

Phirom makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old and married. She has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Yolanda has a feed and rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Yolanda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of feed and rice to resell.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of feed and rice to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for delivery of her baby.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 2º  del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que están luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y con ello poder dar a sus familias una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Zuni es la Presidenta del grupo ella se desempeña como costurera y se describe como una mujer luchadora que para poder salir adelante está poniendo todo de sí y lucha.
Necesita el préstamo para agrandar más su local  de costura, y así poder comprar unas máquinas un poco más adelante. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
This group, known as Las Emprendedoras (the entrepreneurs) is in its second cycle of the Women's Committee Program.  The members of this group are very hard-working women who are fighting to be someone in life, and therefore be able to provide their families with a life of dignity where they are not lacking what they need.  

Zuni, the president of the group, makes a living as a seamstress and describes herself as a women who is giving all she's got and fighting to get ahead.  She needs a loan to expand her sewing workshop, and therefore she can buy more machines in the near future.  She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to continue improving every day.

loans.use: to expand a sewing workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a bathroom in her house and install a toilet so that she and her children can live in a better environment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, and bricks in order to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en 2008 regroupe les membres qui habitent la même ville et ont comme activité le commerce.
Niamakolan qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable,elle est âgée de 36 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 01 garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de chemises en tissu wax.Elle s'approvisionne au niveau du marché central de la ville  puis confectionne des chemises pour  revendre dans son quartier.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 63m de tissus wax à 44100f et le reste de l'argent servira à la confection  de chemise.

Son objectif est de satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle et aider sa famille à faire face aux dépenses liées à la nourriture,à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, created in 2008, is composed of members living in the same town and working in commerce. Niamakolan, appearing at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is the official of the group. She is 36 years old and a married mother of five children, including one boy.

Her business involves shirts made of Wax cloth. She gets her supplies at the town’s central market and then makes shirts to resell in her district. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase 63 meters of Wax cloth for 44,100 francs. The rest of the money will be used for making shirts. 

Her goal is to meet the demands of her customers and to help her family to cope with expenses associated with food and schooling for the children.

loans.use: to purchase Wax cloth

loans.name: Vamos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria ella es conviviente y tiene 67 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agencia de viajes, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de zapatos.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Vamos Juntos"; This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

This member is Gloria, a 67 year old woman in a common-law marriage with 3 children; She works in her grocery store and restaurant business, selling basic essentials like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She wants to get ahead through this business, and she's an enterprising woman who works hard. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She's requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other members work in a travel agency, a clothing business, a grocery store, and a shoe store.

She's grateful to the people that are using this platform to be a part of her dream and she's committed to making good on the loan installments within the stipulated time.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Nhóm 23-Thôn Điền 19-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhung is the group leader of the Nhóm 23-Thôn Điền 19-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Nhung operates a food stall/restaurant, selling cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. Nhung has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Thôn Điền 19-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Thân is 58 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thân is the group leader of the Thôn Điền 19-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Thân works in agriculture, raising poultry. Thân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

This is Thân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Đông Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant to sell rice noodle. She requests a loan to purchase more rice noodle to cook and sell.  Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hiền is a 35-year-old  married woman with 2 children.

Hiền is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Đông Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hiền hopes for her business to do well, her children to do well in school, and  her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more rice noodles.

loans.name: Nhóm 23 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lương operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Lương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Lương faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

Lương is 40 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lương is the group leader of the Nhóm 23 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Lương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 12-Phố 5-P.đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a service business tailoring clothes. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth to do her tailoring service.

Hoa is 38 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa is the group leader of the Nhóm 12-Phố 5-P.Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to do her tailoring service

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 13 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Thắm works in agriculture, raising livestock. Thắm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Thắm is 45 years old, and she is married with four children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thắm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 02 Thôn 13 Quảng Lưu solidarity group. 

In the future, Thắm hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Thôn Tiến 14 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Lan is 36 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan is the group leader of the Thôn Tiến 14 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items (canned goods,eggs, breads and soap) to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 39-year-old single woman.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from an Internet cafe.

Evelyn requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, breads, eggs and personal-care products.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, breads, eggs and personal-care products.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Jannet dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. Flora is widowed and has had a vegetable business for 10 years.

Flora requests 14,000 PHPn through NWTF to purchase squash, chili, garlic, and tomatoes.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  squash, chili, garlic, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. Sharon works very hard to provide for the family.

Sharon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sharon has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Sharon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 42 years old and has four children. Florentina is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Florentina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florentina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Karen Yessenia

texts.es:
Karen es una señora muy trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y su hijito en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad caracterizada por ser muy comercial y además por ser una zona productiva del país.
Karen se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenta que lleva mas de un año ya con negocio local, ella comenzó recorriendo vendiendo ropa interior a clientela referida, ya luego con sus ganancias pudo arrendar un local y comprar perchas para establecer su negocio.
Nos comenta que fue muy duro al principio darse a conocer pero con la constancia pudo salir adelante, cuenta con el apoyo total de su esposo. Actualmente venden pantalones, blusas y ropa interior en un pequeño zaguán, su esposo trabaja junto a ella en un taller de arreglo de celulares. Tienen el negocio muy bien ordenado en la zona más comercial de la ciudad.
Karen tiene la oportunidad de ampliar el negocio ya que el local es grande, por ello con este crédito Karen podrá comprar más vitrinas y perchas para aprovechar el espacio y crecer como microempresaria. Se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada ya que es la primera vez que saca un crédito, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a todos quienes conforman kiva por apoyar a los microempresarios que quieren crecer.
texts.en:
Karen is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband and small son in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city that is known for being very commercial and in a productive part of the country.   

Karen makes a living selling clothing, and she notes that she has had this business for more than a year at it's current location.  She started as a traveling salesman selling underwear to clients by reference, and then later she was able to use the profits to rent a store and buy hangers to establish her business.  She mentions that it was very hard to put herself on the map at the beginning, but she was able to move ahead through her persistence, and she has the total support of her husband.  

Presently they are selling pants, shirts, and underwear out of a small hallway, and her husband works with her at a cellphone repair workshop.  They have set up their business nicely in a very commercial part of the city.  

Karen has the opportunity to expand the business to a larger location, and therefore she will use the loan to buy more display cases and hangers to take advantage of the space and grow as a microenterprise.  She is grateful for the opportunity and this is the first time she has taken out a loan.  She thanks Fundación Alternativa and all of the members of Kiva for their support of microenterprises who want to grow.

loans.use: to buy more display cases and hangers to take advantage of her space

loans.name: Nuris Veronica

texts.es:
Nuris, vive con su esposo, quién también genera ingresos económicos, ella es una persona dedicada a desempeñar labores domésticas y que desde hace dos años también práctica la crianza de cerdos, realiza la compra de los mismo cuando tienen corta edad, posteriormente los cuida y engorda para luego venderlos y obtener ingresos con los que apoya en los gastos de la casa.
Solicita un crédito para comprar concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos y facilitar su crianza, espera tener un negocio más popular y  mejores ingresos económicos, que piensa utilizar para reducir las necesidades que existen en su hogar. 
Sus aspiraciones son mantener una buena imagen personal en su comunidad y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nuris lives with her husband, who also earns an income. She is a person who works in the home, and for the last two years she has also been raising pigs. She buys them when they are young and then cares for them and fattens them in order to sell them and earn income to help with the household expenses.

She is seeking a loan to buy concentrated feed to give to the pigs and to help with raising them. She hopes that her business will become more popular and thereby offer her a better income, which she will use to reduce the needs in her home. 

She hopes to present a good image in her community, and she hopes to keep working in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for her pigs and helps with raising them.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jennifer is 31 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Jennifer has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products of ready-to-wear to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 51, is a married mother of five children, and three of them are in school. She is living in Battambang province. Potato farming and working for other farms are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, and it earns her about 65,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She applies for this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she could earn more income and renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Na Tau 9 Group

texts.en:
Hong is 20-year-old ethnic Thai lady who is married and has a small daughter. She lives with her husband and her child, along with her husband's family in a traditional ethnic Thai house. 

Living in a small village where people mainly work at agricultural production, Hong's family also relies on cultivation and animal husbandry with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, growing vegetables, edible canna, and raising chickens, pigs, and fish for a living. 

Because of the unstable characteristics of agriculture, Hong has always wanted to expand production. This is the second time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use it to buy young fish and increase fish farming. She hopes that her investment will go well so that she can improve significantly her family's income. 

Hong dreams that her child will grow up healthy, escape from poverty and have a more abundant life. In the picture, she stands on the first line, first on the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish and increase fish farming.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
The members of Roeurn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. 

Roeurn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zoila Amarilis

texts.es:
Zoila es una chica emprendedora, es soltera y  vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo hace varios años. Habita actualmente en casa de su madre.
Zoila le gusta trabajar,  cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa interior por catálogo, ella recorre a vecinas del sector, emprendió este negocio hace varios años ya que decidió estudiar y con los ingresos podía pagar sus estudios. Zoila ya es clienta antigua de la fundación, ha trabajado con créditos para poder matricularse, actualmente cursa ya uno de los últimos semestres, se siente feliz por el apoyo de su familia y de la institución.
Zoila quiere ser una profesional muy pronto, por ello con este crédito pagará su semestre universitario y además parte de ello invertirá en capital de trabajo para seguir con el negocio y salir adelante.
Zoila está feliz por el apoyo brindado de la institución, es una clienta fiel a la institución.
texts.en:
Zoila es una chica emprendedora, es soltera y  vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo hace varios años. Habita actualmente en casa de su madre.
Zoila le gusta trabajar,  cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa interior por catálogo, ella recorre a vecinas del sector, emprendió este negocio hace varios años ya que decidió estudiar y con los ingresos podía pagar sus estudios. Zoila ya es clienta antigua de la fundación, ha trabajado con créditos para poder matricularse, actualmente cursa ya uno de los últimos semestres, se siente feliz por el apoyo de su familia y de la institución.
Zoila quiere ser una profesional muy pronto, por ello con este crédito pagará su semestre universitario y además parte de ello invertirá en capital de trabajo para seguir con el negocio y salir adelante.
Zoila está feliz por el apoyo brindado de la institución, es una clienta fiel a la institución.

Zoila is a single, enterprising woman who has lived in the city of Santo Domingo for several years. She currently lives in her mother's house. Zoila enjoys working and has a business selling clothing by catalogue to area inhabitants. She started this business several years ago since she decided to go to school and could use the income to pay for her studies. Zoila is a long-time member of the foundation, having used loans to be able to enroll in school. Currently she's working on one of the final semesters and feels happy because of the support that the foundation and her family have given her. Zoila wants to be a professional very soon, that's why she'll use this loan to pay for the university semester and in addition invest part of it in working capital to keep going with her business and get ahead. Zoila is happy because of the help that the institution has provided her, she's a loyal member.

loans.use: To pay for her semester at the university and invest in working capital to keep her business going

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Poderosas   está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Margarita es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas varias de bebidas, comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Margarita se destaca por ser una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida e ir mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias para la venta, como ser: gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group's name is Mujeres Poderosas, and is in its first cycle with the Women's Committee where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead.
Margarita is one of the members of the group, and she works in the sale of beverages. She states that it's going well for her, since it has given her the means to be able to help her loved ones. Margarita stands out because she's a person that strives to be somebody in life and keep improving. She's requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of various beverages for sale such as; soft drinks, beer, wine, and more so that she can keep going with her sales just like she has been doing.

loans.use: To purchase various beverages for selling such as: soft drinks, beer, wine, and more.

loans.name: Renacer 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer 3 todas ellas de la ciudad de  Itá está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que están luchando y esmerándose para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sara quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas y con ello poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
This group, known as Renacer 3, whose members are all from the city of Itá, is in its first cycle of the Women's Committee Program.  The members of this group are very hard-working women who are taking great pains to fight to be someone in life.  

One of the group members is Sara, who makes a living selling fruit.  She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who is fighting to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing it.  She is giving her all to be able to grow and help her family and loved ones.  She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fresh fruit so that she can continue fighting.  She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit for sale

loans.name: Foune's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis décembre 2010 réunis des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme lien commun la responsabilité du remboursement du crédit.

Macouta qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est l'emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 36 ans et mére de 08 enfants dont 01 garçon.

Son activité est le commerce du bois de bambou et du maïs.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 20 sacs de  maïs à 7500f le sac et 30 bois de bambou à 1250f l'unité.

Son objectif est d'assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group, created in December 2010, is composed of members living in the same village and bound together by the responsibility of loan repayments. 

Macouta, appearing at the far right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is 36 years old and a mother of eight children, including one boy.

Her commerce involves bamboo wood and corn. 

With this loan, she intends to buy 20 sacks of corn at 7,500 francs per sack; and 30 units of bamboo at 1,2500 francs per unit. 

Her goal is to ensure her family’s essential needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo wood and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, a toilet, PVC pipes, and sand, and pay for the labor needed to improve her sanitation facilities.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de elotes, desde hace 5 años y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con padre, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man has had his face blurred because he is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk zone.  He makes a living growing corn, and he has been selling his produce in different markets near his home for 5 years.  He lives in his own home with his father.  

He is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, manure, and insecticides, among other products, to be able to continue growing his crops and  make a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, manure, and insecticides, among other things

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.en:
Hikoyat is a hardworking woman. She was born in one of the northern districts of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married and has four children. 

Hikoyat is a very kind, goal oriented and hospitable person. She is responsible to raise her children in a good standard of living. 

Recently, she felt some difficulties because her son had a surgical operation and was three months in hospital. 

The standard of their living was hard, until her husband started to do business in agriculture. She also helped her husband in agriculture. Then she decided to be trained at startup training provided by IMON. 

She is planning to buy livestock and do business. Hikoyat asks for a loan to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and help her husband to feed their family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and do business

loans.name: Ciro Javier

texts.es:
Ciro Javier tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, maíz y yucas, comercio de animales menores, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de jornalería como peón agrícola, tiene herramientas propias que le facilitan el trabajo agrícola, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar una motosierra y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio, que le generará ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ciro Javier is 44 years old and lives in the Oyotun district, where inhabitants make a living by farming rice, corn and yucca, and selling small animals. It's located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

He's a farm worker who provides service as a day laborer. He has his own tools which makes farm work easier, is experienced in this field and has good personal and work references in his district. He has requested a loan to purchase a chainsaw so that he can offer better service, which would generate additional income towards a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw so that he can offer better service.

loans.name: Nhóm 03, Thôn 4, Trường Giang Group

texts.en:
Vinh is 55 years old. She is married and has three children. Vinh is the group leader of the Nhóm 03, Thôn 4, Trường Giang Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 

Vinh works in agriculture, raising livestock. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Vinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Thôn Đức 23- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood and fish to resell.

Loan is 28 years old, and she is married with three children. Loan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Loan is the group leader of the Thôn Đức 23- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Thôn Thuận 17- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en: Mai is 33 years old and is married with three children. She is the group leader of the Thôn Thuận 17- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong District, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. Mai has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. This is Mai's first loan with Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, 42, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. Jocelyn has a retail bread business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 13 years. Jocelyn requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to purchase more bread to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a 35-year-old and married woman with two children who are still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Anabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, eggs and noodles. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Anabelle has been in this business for 18 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Elizabet

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, su día con día lo comparte con su esposo e hijos, tiene un negocio de subsistencia para la familia que consiste en la elaboración y venta de tortillas, lo hace en un horario de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, trabaja de forma independiente desde hace más de 10 años, el oficio le fue enseñado por su familia.
