Piensa en surtir su inventario con la materia prima para trabajar por una larga temporada, al no contar con recursos económicos para hacerlo se decidió por solicitar un préstamo para comprar maíz y leña, tendrá oportunidad de elaborar la venta de tortillas diaria, espera que la productividad sea más grande, ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor producto y que sus ingresos sean mayores, el negocio por el momento no presenta riesgos para mantenerlo en actividad.
Para Ana sus sueños son que cuando sea necesario pueda costear los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y tener una vida digna con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is married and lives with her husband and children. She has a small business for her family making and selling tortillas, which she works at from six in the morning until two in the afternoon. She has been working for herself for more than ten years, her family taught her the trade. 

She would like to stock her inventory with enough raw materials to allow her to work for a long period. Since she does not have the financial means to do this, she decided to request a loan to buy corn and firewood, so she can make and sell tortillas every day. She hopes her productivity will increase, and she can offer her customers a better product, and increase her earnings. At the moment their are no risks to keeping the business active. 
For Ana, her dreams are being able to pay for her children's college education when the time comes, and having a dignified life with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood so she can make and sell tortillas on a daily basis

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna, 40, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For 15 years, Johna has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Johna requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), in order to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Johna would like to save money, expand her business, and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima sigue estudiando arduamente en su carrera de odontología, para poder ir mejorando cada día por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo, y para que el día de mañana sea una profesional que sea útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a los demás. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y eso le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide nuevamente de este prestamos y quiere poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Fatima continues to study hard at dentistry in order to improve each day through her effort and determination, so that in the future she can be a useful professional, not only for herself but for others.She comments that her previous loan allowed her to pay her university tuition and that was great help. Today again she is requesting this loan and she wants to pay her tuition once again so she can continue her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in laminate sheeting, beams and cement to construct a veranda at her house.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 53 years old and has six children, three of whom attend school. She lives in a rural area of Battambang province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland and potatoes on two and a half hectares and works for another farm for a fee, which she has been doing for many years. She earns about 90,500 KHR per day. 

Thy is requesting her fifth loan fromn VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pay for labor and plowing fees to support her farming. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor and plowing fees

loans.name: Ndiang Bambodj Mousdalipha Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis le 9 Décembre 2010.Les membres habitent dans le même quartier et ont une bonne entente.

Fatou âgée de 45 ans est mariée et mère 03 enfants , 01 garçon et 02 filles.Elle fait du commerce de tissu(brodé). Elle a plus de 15 ans d'expérience et son activité marche bien.Elle est debout à droite la main levée.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter un lot de brodé à 450000 F CFA qu'elle va  revendre au détail pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices,elle cotise à une tontine;participe aux charges de la maison pour les besoins de ses enfants et renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 9, 2010, is composed of members living in the same district and who get along well. 

Fatou, aged 45, is a married mother of three children (a boy and two girls). She does commerce in fabrics (embroidered). She has over fifteen years of experience, and her business is doing well. She is standing at the right with a hand raised. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase a unit of embroidered fabrics for 450,000 francs that she is going to resell to make a lot of revenue. 

With her profits, she will make payments to a tontine, help to cover children-related expenses at home, and bolster her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to sell

loans.name: Sira's Group

texts.fr:
Groupe créé depuis 2010,il rassemble les membres qui habitent dans le même village et ont comme activité en générale le commerce.

Toutou à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est l'emprunteuse vedette,elle est mariée,est âgée de 29 ans et mére de 08 enfants dont 07 filles.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus teintés et de tissus wax.Elle approvisionne durant les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village.

Elle compte acheter 40 yard de tissus teintés à 10000f le yard,6.5 yard de tissus wax à 7500f le yard.

Son objectif est de contribuer aux dépenses liées à la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group, created in 2010, is composed of members living in the same village. Their work involves commerce in general. 

Toutou, appearing at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is 29 years old and a mother of eight children, including seven girls.

She is active in the commerce of dyed fabrics and Wax cloth. She gets her supplies when the weekly markets take place, And she resells the goods in her village.

She intends to purchase 40 yards of dyed fabrics at 10,000 francs per yard; and 6.5 yards of Wax cloth at 7,500 francs per yard. 

Her goal is to help cover food-related expenses.

loans.use: to purchase dyed fabrics and some Wax cloth

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2010,il rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et partagent un lien commun à savoir la responsabilité du remboursement du crédit.

Aminata qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est célibataire,est âgée de 27 ans.

Elle dispose d'une boutique dans son village,elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de son département ou le grand marché qui se trouve en ville.

Elle compte acheter avec les 100000f du riz,de l'huile,de l'oignon,de la pomme de terre,du sucre.

Les bénéfices serviront à participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille,augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created in December 2010, is composed of members living in the same village and sharing a common tie, that is, the responsibility of paying back a loan. 

Aminata, appearing at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is unmarried and 27 years old.

She has a store in her village. She gets her supplies at the big market in her district or at the big market located in town. 

She intends to use 100,000 francs to purchase some rice, oil, onions, potatoes, and sugar.

The profits will be used to help cover the family’s day-to-day expenses and to increase her saving.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessities for stocking her store

loans.name: 02 Tân Sơn 2, Pnam Ngạn, Tpth Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hảo works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and sell. She is 51 years old and is married with 2 children.

Hảo is the group leader of the 02 Tân Sơn 2, Pnam Ngạn, Tpth solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. They live in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area of Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Hảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hảo hopes to build a new house. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat was born in one of the northern districts of Tajikistan in 1957. She is living in a small village with her family. She is a widow and has three children.  After the death of her husband, supporting her family was hard. It was not easy to feed her family alone. Her daughter is sick and Inobat needs extra income to pay medical expenses. She had experience in agriculture when she was young. She went to IMON and was informed about their services. Inobat decided to participate in IMON’s training for start-up clients. After training she decided to start her business in agriculture and earn money to feed her family. She understands it is not easy to do for the first time, but she knows she is capable of running a business. Inobat requested a loan to buy livestock to start her new business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start her new business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old, married, and manages a firewood-selling business. Aside from selling firewood, she also has a buy-and-sell vegetable business for additional income. She hopes to increase her sales, but had insufficient funds to buy more goods to sell. 

So she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy more firewood to sell. 

Additional revenue will help sustain the needs of her children and as revolving capital to continue to operate her small business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Andrica

texts.en:
With the help of her previous loan, Andrica was able to increase her product inventory as well as improve her income from business. The business profits also assisted with their everyday expenditures at home.

She already repaid that loan, and she is asking again the ever generous Kiva lenders for another loan assistance worth Php 20,000. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase additional raw materials and supplies she needs to make more peanut butter. She will also add more direct selling items like toothpaste, perfume, cosmetics, detergents and other products she will be needing for her customers. 

The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Andrica dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman someday. She also wants to see her children finish their studies, became professionals, and having their businesses, too. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more ingredients in making peanut butter and also direct selling products to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Candelaria is 52 years old and has six children who are in school.

Candelaria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Candelaria has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Jirah

texts.en:
Jirah is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jirah is 42 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Jirah has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jirah has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 31-year-old married mother of one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marissa has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more inventory of clothing to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to enough save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Art's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Battambang province, Art is 54 years old and a mother of four children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping on three hectares farmland and selling grocery items. Art has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven loan cycles already, and fully repaid the loan. Now she leads a group of four to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Na Tau 8 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Un, 25, is an ethnically Thai lady who is the married mother of 2 small boys. She lives with her husband and children, along with her mother-in-law, in a traditional Thai house. Despite plenty of difficulties and deficiencies in life, they live together very happily and work very hard for their living in agricultural production. 

Because of the instability of earnings from agriculture, Mrs. Un has diversified their cultivation and animal husbandry with a variety of activities by both growing rice, edible canna, and cassava, and raising buffalo, pigs, chickens, and ducks. 

This is the first time that Mrs. Un has taken a loan from the Anh Chi Em program, and she will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. She believes that with the training and counselling on raising pigs from the Program's staff, her investment will go smoothly. She hopes that her family's income will increase significantly so that their living conditions will improve. 

In the picture above, Mrs. Un stands with her group, wearing the blue coat.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Bunthoeurn is 63 years old and a father of two children. He grows cucumbers and sells grocery items to earn more income.

This is the ninth loan for Bunthoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming. He hopes that he can get more yields than last year to earn more income and have a better living life style.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN PADRE DE FAMILIA  EJEMPLAR, SE PREOCUPA DEMASIADO POR SUS HIJOS. UNA DE SUS HIJAS ACTUALMENTE SUFRE MOLESTIAS EN SU DENTADURA, LO QUE LO TIENE PREOCUPADO, YA QUE DE NO SER ATENDIDA PUEDA PERDER SUS PIEZAS DENTALES LO QUE AFECTARIA LA AUTOESTIMA DE LA PEQUEÑA. EL HACE TRABAJOS TEMPORALES POR LO QUE DESGRACIADAMENTE NO CUENTA CON INGRESOS PARA PROPORCIONARLE UN BUEN TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en:
This gentleman is an exemplary father who is overly concerned about his children. One of his daughters is currently having pain with her teeth and this has him worried. If this problem is not addressed, she could lose her teeth and be left with very little self-esteem.

The borrower works temporary jobs, so unfortunately he does not earn enough income to secure treatment.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's dental treatment.

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Y La Verdad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the communal bank Jesus Es El Camino y La Verdad. This bank is located in the Cusco district, belong to the Cusco province, and the Cusco department.

The borrower Victoria is single. She is 51 years old and has 2 children. She works in the grocery store business. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00AM until 7:00PM. She has been working in this business for 5 years and it is going well. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. 

The other members work in agricultural sales, breeding livestock, grocery store businesses, and animal sales.

The borrower is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies

loans.name: 11 - Phú Thọ 2 - Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Hiền has a retail business selling electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

Hiền is 31 years old and is married with one child.
Hiền is the group leader of the 11 - Phú Thọ 2 - Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Hiền lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for five years.
The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell

loans.name: 08-03-02 Tây Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Dần is 52 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Dần has a service business sewing clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is the group leader of the 08-03-02 Tây Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2014, Dần joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is applying for a loan to purchase more cloth to do tailoring services.  

With her business profit, Dần hopes to travel for vacation within the country. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to do tailoring services

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Nam Ngạn 2 P Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hằng has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items to resell.

Hằng is 58 years old and is married with two children.
Hằng is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 Nam Ngạn 2 P Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
Hằng lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women microfinance institution to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa.
Hằng has been involved in this business for five years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

loans.name: 07 Nam Ngạn 4, P Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Năng workd in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Năng is 53 years old and married with two children.
Năng is the group leader of the 07 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Năng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women microfinance institution to improve her  business. Năng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Năng has been involved in this business for five years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Năng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 18 - Phu Thọ 2 - Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Linh has a service business repairing motorcycles. She is applying for a loan to purchase more motorcycle parts for her repair service.  

Linh is 25 years old and married with no children.
Linh is the group leader of the 18 - Phu Thọ 2 - Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Linh lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Linh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Linh has been involved in this business for five years.
The main hardship that Linh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Linh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more motorcycle parts to do motorcycle repairing service

loans.name: Solida's Group

texts.en: Solida is 25 years old and a mother of one child. She lives in a rural area of Ek Phnom district, Battambang province. To earn a living, she tailors clothes and raises pigs as the main sources of income. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of three to get this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy piglets and pig feed. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 67 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gilda has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Gilda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Gilda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gilda would like to repair and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Channe's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Battambang province, Channe is 29 years old. To earn a living, she grows rice on 7 hectares of farmland. She also earns income by working for other farms for a fee. For Channe, this is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more money and would be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en: Chin, 54, lives in Battambang province. She is a married mother of five children and only one of them is in school. Growing rice on 2 hectares of farmland and house building have been the sources of her family’s income for 15 years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loans already and fully repaid them. Now, she is leading a group of three members to apply for this loan with her portion to be used to buy seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she could earn more money and would be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lonah's Group

texts.en:
Lonah, pictured above, is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has four children.

With her portion of this loan, Lonah will not only purchase maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Lonah plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Lonah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. The group members will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eyeglasses.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es: Virgilio de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café, tiene 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura la cual inicio con capital propio, su cosecha la almacena en los graneros y los comercializa en los meses de noviembre a junio en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 62 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion. He is a farmer who grows primarily corn, beans, and coffee. Virgilio has 15 years of experience in agriculture and started with his own capital. His harvest is stored in granaries and then sold in the months of November through June at different markets located near his home. With the income he generates from his sales, he is able to get ahead.

Virgilio is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can continue cultivating his crops and have more income.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: 030207050003.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Hương has a stall selling processed food. She applied for a loan to purchase more food to process for sale.
Hương is 32 years old and married with two children.
Hương is the group leader of the 030207050003.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
Hương lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hương has been involved in this business for five years.
The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more food to process for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas desde hace mas de 5 años el cual inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones por las lluvias, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de polines y laminas y asi el y su familia puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 33 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and daughter. He has been doing metal work for more than five years and started with his own capital. With the income he earns from his work, Antonio is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He wants to improve his home by replacing the roof, which is in poor condition because of the rain. However, he does not earn enough from his work to cover the cost. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy beams and corrugated metal sheets. As a result, his family will be able to live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: buy beams and corrugated metal sheets so that he can replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: 030504100004.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Thúy works in agriculture farming vegetables. She applied for a loan to purchase seed to farm vegetables to sell.
Thúy is 30 years old and married with two children.
Thúy is the group leader of the 030504100004.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase seed to farm vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elijah's Group

texts.en:
Elijah is 47 years old and has six children. He is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Elijah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family. He described his last harvest as good and believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Elijah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about as it will allow him to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Elijah's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae is 36 years old and married with one child who is in school. Sheila Mae works very hard to provide for her family.

Sheila Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sheila Mae has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Sheila Mae would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Laikeu's Group

texts.en:
Laikeu is 47 years old and has five children, three of whom attend school. She lives in Kampong Thom Province. Growing rice, which she has been doing for 29 years, is the main source of her family’s income. Laikeu earns additional income growing vegetables. She earns about 41,700 KHR per day. 

Laikeu is requesting a new loan from VisionFund with her group of six members. She will use her portion to buy a decent latrine for her family’s use. She hopes that this loan will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Priscano's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Priscano, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 59 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is married and has four children.

Priscano is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again since this means that she is able to earn enough money to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Priscano says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has significantly improved her day-to-day life. Priscano will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 10.5 acres. Given that one member of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy, 49, is a married mother of three children, two of them dependents, and lives in Kandal province. To support her family, Savy grows rice and vegetables to sell. This has been her income source for more than five years. She earns around (USD) $17 per day through her business. She is now applying for this third loan to buy fertilizer for farming. She hopes that she could gain more yield from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: 030501140003.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 030501140003.thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

Ngọc works in agriculture, and she has applied for a loan to purchase seeds for farming vegetables to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

In 2014, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 2 loans from them.

With her business profit, Ngoc hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids. She also hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for farming vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a 49-year-old married woman with four children, 3 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alona has a food production business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Alona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn  is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 39 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Jocelyn has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. She  requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell such as bananas, papayas, mangos, apples, oranges, etc.

Jocelyn  has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell such as bananas, papayas, mangos, apples, oranges, etc

loans.name: Lear's Group

texts.en:
Lear is 65 years old and the proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader representing her group of 10 farmers in the Matete District, and she is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Lear has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She described her harvest last year as excellent, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

She is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light aswell as the fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With this loan, Lear’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Samuel is a 49-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Samuel has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Samuel described his harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Samuel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sugeydis Del Rocio

texts.es:
Sugeydis una mujer casada, muy dedicada al hogar y a la familia, siempre había estado a espaldas de su esposo, esperando que este se encargara de los gastos del hogar y con el tiempo fue acumulando un sentimiento de impotencia al sentirse algo innecesaria porque no trabaja ni generaba recursos, por ello realizo un esfuerzo para montar una tienda de abarrotes en su vereda de Las Córdobas, un negocio que cambió drásticamente la forma de pensar y de vivir de Sugeydis , las razones son que pudo tener una forma de ganarse la vida sin depender de su esposo, al ser dos personas las que trabajan las condiciones de vida en su vivienda mejoraron considerablemente y pudo tener una paz y una tranquilidad al saber que trabaja.

Su sueño es consolidar su negocio, que nunca le llegue a faltar trabajo y un día ojala no muy lejano ser la propietaria de un supermercado.

Sugeydis quiere solicitar tu apoyo para la compra de surtido de abarrotes como lo son panela, café, chocolate, arepas, pastas, aceite, candela, fósforos, productos de aseo.
texts.en:
Sugeydis, a married woman, is very dedicated to her home and family. She has always given support to her husband, hoping that he could take charge of covering family expenses. And over time, she accumulated a sense of impotence and a lack of usefulness because she did not work, nor did she generate resources. 

For that reason, Sugeydis undertook the effort to start a grocery store on her lot in Las Cordobas, a business that drastically changed her way of thinking and living. That is because she was able to earn her living, without depending on her husband. With two people working, their life conditions at home improved considerably, and she achieved peace and tranquility, knowing that she was working.

Sugeydis's dream is to consolidate her business, so that she will never lack work and, hopefully, one day in the not too distant future, she will be the proprietor of a supermarket.

Sugeydis wishes to request your help in order to purchase a selection of groceries to sell, such as unrefined brown sugar, coffee, chocolate, arepas (fried corn cakes), pasta, cooking oil, candles, matches, and cleaning products.

loans.use: buy a selection of groceries to sell, such as unrefined brown sugar, coffee, chocolate, arepas, pasta, cooking oil, candles, matches, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine, pictured above, has been a farmer for 14 years. She is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. She is 37 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Josephine likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Josephine plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Josephine’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
IRSHAD is the age of 51; she is the mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

IRSHAD sews the bags along with her son and two daughters at home to feed her family. She has two sewing machines which are operated by her daughters for sewing school and hand bags. Her son deals with outside customers, taking orders from them to sew the bags on order.

IRSHAD wants to buy an additional sewing machine for younger daughter, but does not have enough cash on hand. Therefore, IRSHAD has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can buy an additional sewing machine and some stock of raw materials such as rexine, zippers, buckles, etc for sewing bags.

Her desire is to sell her sewed bags directly to the market so that she can get the maximum reward against mutual efforts. 

IRSHAD thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine and some raw materials for sewing bags.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of nine farmers in Matete District. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five children.

Judith likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Judith plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Judith’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Toetratsimiady Voahirana

texts.fr:
Voahirana est une jeune femme travailleuse, souriante, et dynamique. Elle a presque tous les caractères requis pour attirer les clients.Elle a une bonne attitude commerciale: accueillante.
Elle vend des vêtements fripes depuis 2 ans, et avant ça des jouets d'occasion. Elle a demandé un prêt pour acheter des  marchandises supplémentaires en ce moment de changement de saison.
Notons que la plupart des gens préfèrent acheter  les fripes car c'est à moindre coûts par rapport aux nouvelles confections.
Voahirana  a 22 ans, elle est heureusement mariée, son mari est menuisier. Ils ont deux enfants de 5 et 3 ans.
Seul le premier qui va à l'école actuellement
Son rêve est de pouvoir construire une maison en dur car celle où sa famille habite est encore construis en bois.
texts.en:
Voahirana is a young, hard-working, smiley and dynamic woman.  She has almost all of the required characteristics to attract customers.  She has a good business attitude: welcoming.  
She has been selling second-hand clothes for two years, and toys before that.  She has asked for a loan to buy some extra merchandise at the moment for the changing season.
It is noticeable that the majority of people prefer to buy second-hand as they are cheaper than new items.
Voahirana is 22 years old and happily married to a carpenter.  They have two children aged 5 and 3.
Only the eldest currently attends school.
Her dream is to be able to build a permanent house because they still live in one made of wood.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes like: jackets, dresses, trousers, skirts,...

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is an active girl. She was born into a family of workers in 1994. She lives in a rural area in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is single and lives with parents, and she always supports and helps her parents in the household. 

Zuhro has been interested in biology and chemistry since her childhood. She has now entered a university and is studying with excellence. She likes her chosen subject and wants to become a specialist in the field of biology and chemistry. She is well-known among friends and teachers. 

Zuhro has asked for a loan to pay her tuition fees for university. She hopes to be supported, and wishes in the future to be useful in the rural area where she lives.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for university

loans.name: Thanh Yen 5 Group

texts.en:
Huong, aged 35, is a Thai ethnic woman who is married with two children: a girl and a boy. She lives with her husband and children in a small house. She works in agriculture with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice and growing corn, and raising pigs, chickens and ducks. 

Huong works very hard but the income generated from her agricultural production is unstable and insufficient to cover her family's living expenses. For this reason, she has continuously increased and expanded production. This is the fourth time that she has received a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, and she will use this loan to buy piglets and food for her pigs. 

Huong hopes that her investment will go smoothly so that she will earn a good income and be able to significantly improve her family's living conditions. She dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her children. 

In the picture, she is wearing a black coat and is the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for her pigs

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokchea, 43, is a married mother of three children with two of them in school. They are living in Kratie province. 

Growing potatoes and working for other farms have been the sources of her family’s income for six years, and it earns her about 40,000KHR per day. 

She is now leading a group of three to apply for this loan, with her portion being used to buy fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee. 

She hopes that she could earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Luzcely

texts.es:
Luz hoy está cumpliendo un sueño y se le da la bienvenida al mundo del emprendimiento ella una mujer de 27 años de edad, casada con dos hijos una de 7 y otro de 5 iniciara un negocio de cría de aves, ya que conoce la profesión por su niñez donde aprendió mucho gracias a sus padres. 

Ella quiere demostrar la verraquera, el ánimo y su anhelo de tener empresa que le permita aportar su granito de arena en la mejora de calidad de vida de su familia.

Hoy llega ante la comunidad Kiva para solicitar un aliento económico con lo que comprara 120 pollos y alimento, con esto iniciara su empresa, esperando a convertirse en poco tiempo en una fuerte competidora y mayorista de venta de pollos.
texts.en:
Luz is fulfilling a dream today. She is saying hello the world of entrepreneurship. She is a 27 year old married woman with two children aged 7 and 5 years old. She is starting a business raising poultry, a business she already knows, learning it as a child where she learned a lot thanks to her parents.

She wants to show the nerve, the disposition and the desire to have a business which will allow her to contribute her bit to improve the quality of living of her family. Today she comes before the Kiva community to request economic assistance to buy 120 chickens and feed to start her business. She hopes to convert it in a short time to be a strong competitor and wholesaler in poultry sales.

loans.use: to start a  business raising poultry, buying 120 chickens.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Valientes  es un grupo fortalecido actualmente están en el 3er ciclo con 19 integrantes, todas con un objetivo en común, ayudar a mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Beatriz, tiene una cantina en una escuela. Ella prepara empanaditas, milanesas y otras minutas acompañando con postres, dulces y frutas que lleva a la escuela para el desayuno o merienda de los chicos. Pide este préstamo para la compra de lácteos y otros comestibles para la venta.
Todas se esfuerzan para solventar los gastos del hogar por lo mismo se sienten muy agradecidas por formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Valientes” (Valiant Women) is a well-established group that is in its third loan cycle with 19 members. All of them have a common goal of helping to improve the living situations of their families.

One of the members is Sra. Beatriz, who owns a snack bar at a school. She prepares small empanadas, breaded meats, and other quick meals that are served with desserts, sweets, and fruit. Beatriz brings the food to the school and then sells them to the children for breakfast or afternoon snacks. She is requesting a loan in order to buy dairy products and other food items to sell.

All of her efforts are focused on providing for her household expenses. At the same, Beatriz and her fellow group members are very appreciative of being able to participate in the Women’s Committee Program.

loans.use: to buy dairy products and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is a widow and has three children. She has experience of buying and selling food items. 

Now she participated in the Start-Up training provided by IMON and decided to open a new business trading textiles for traditional women's dresses. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy textiles and start doing business. 

She hopes her business will be more profitable and she will feed her family. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy textiles and start doing business.

loans.name: Litoral Group

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio fabril ’18 de mayo’ sitio caracterizado por el gran crecimiento del comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas y por los orígenes de su población proveniente de tribus ‘Ayoreas’ nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país, de clima tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Natividad es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, viste polera naranja). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con trecho de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su ganas de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de desayunos, servicio de transporte, venta de chinelas, taller de soldadura, venta de lácteos y venta de carteras, para solicita run préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; empanadas, hamburguesas, salchipapas, pollo frito y otros. Actividad que realiza durante las horas del día de lunes a sábado, en un kiosco propio sin techo ni muebles. “vendo comida y vendo tacús, que sirve para moler la yuca, instrumento básico en todas las cocinas del lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la costumbre de los pobladores de comer al paso, la desventaja es la falta de mobiliario para mejorar la atención al cliente y las ventas. Su sueño es abrir una cadena de restaurantes de comida rápida, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children who are 3 and 7 years old.  Her business is selling traditional food.  She is a good mother, enterprising, understanding, patient, responsible, and hard-working.  She carries out her business in the industrial neighborhood "18 de Mayo".  This place is characterized by great commercial growth and manufacturing of all kinds, its population originating from the native "Ayoreas" tribes as well as from miners who relocated from the western part of the country, and by its tropical climate with daily temperatures between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Natividad has a dark complexion, dark eyes, and long black hair that she wears tied up.  She is short and has a robust physique.  Her native language is Guaraní but she speaks Spanish in the general public and for work.  (She is the first on the left, wearing an orange shirt.)  She shares her life with her partner, who works as a builder, and her children.  The oldest child attends school and the youngest is not yet school-aged.  They live in a rented room made of brick and cement.  It has a corrugated metal roof, potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Natividad's desire to better herself led her to form a communal bank with other people in order to ask for a loan and improve their businesses.  The other members' businesses include selling secondhand clothing, selling breakfast, transportation services, selling slippers, a welding workshop, selling dairy products, and selling wallets. Natividad's business consists of selling fast food like empanadas, hamburgers, sausages, fried chicken, and other items.  It is a job she carries out during the day from Monday to Saturday in her own kiosk, but it does not have a roof or any furniture.  

"I sell food and I sell tacús (a type of mortar and pestle) which are used to grind the yuca; they are basic tools in all the kitchens in this area..." she says.

One advantage to her business is the population's habit of walking and eating.  A disadvantage is her lack of furniture for improving the care she gives her customers and improving her sales.  Her dream is to open a chain of fast food restaurants.  She wishes to expand her business through the purchase of tables and chairs in order to provide better comfort for her customers and to improve her sales.  This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has carried out this business.

It is for these reasons that Natividad is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs in order to provide better comfort for her customers and to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to provide better comfort for her customers and improve her sales.

loans.name: Fawade

texts.fr:
Fawade est membre du groupe depuis le 16 Décembre 2011.
 
Elle fait partie des membres du comité de gestion de son Banc Villageois.Elle est une femme leader et exemplaire. 

Elle est âgée de 43ans.Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 1 garçon.

Elle compte investir les 300000 F CFA pour acheter des habits(friperies). Avec le reste de l'argent,elle va acheter divers produits et assurer son transport.

Elle mène cette activité au marché de sa localité depuis plus 17 ans. Elle maîtrise bien son activité et elle n'a pas beaucoup de concurrents.

Avec les bénéfices,elle va renforcer son épargne et appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille.
texts.en:
Fawade has been a member of the group since December 16, 2011.
 
She is a member of the management committee for her 'banc villageois’ and is an exemplary woman leader. 

She is 43 years old and the married mother of three children, including a boy.

She is planning on investing the 300,000 francs CFA to purchase some clothing (used). The rest of the money will be used by her to purchase a variety of goods and to ensure transportation. 

She has been operating her business at the market in her town for over seventeen years. She has a good mastery of her business, and she does not have much competition.  

With the profits, she is going to bolster her savings and support her husband in managing the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing (used) to be sold

loans.name: Turwanyinzara  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Evariste  fait partie du groupe  Turwanyinzara et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Solange, une commerçantes. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 10 ans, dont  3 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de  viande  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une vache à abattre  pour la vente de la viande, afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  être un grand commerçant de bière industrielle, et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Evariste is part of the group Turwanyinzara and lives in  Bujumbura. He is 31 years old and married to Solange, a merchant. Together they have four children, aged 1 to 10 years old, of whom three are students. 

Evariste has been doing commerce in meat for five years. 

He is on his 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a cow to slaughter and sell for meat, so as to earn more.

In the years to come, he would like to be a major merchant of commercial beer and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to slaughter and sell for meat, so as to earn more

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Curahuasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE CURAHUASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Curahuasi, perteneciente a la provincia de Abancay y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria ella es casada y tiene 65 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer de Curahuasi” which is located in the District of Curahuasi in Abancay Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Gloria. She is 65 years old, married, and has seven children. Gloria works at her restaurant business where she prepares different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and beef stir fry. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. Gloria has been this business for nine years and is doing very well. Her dream is to continue owning her restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members engage in businesses that involve agriculture, selling food, selling groceries, and selling animals.

Gloria is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and she also grows organic oil palms. She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 46 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school.

Paulina is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through fair trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a micro loan to expand her organic oil palm field. 

This will help her fund her children’s education while developing a property that will yield fruit for years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified palm oil mill, and she also grows organic palm oil trees. She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 42 years old and married with three children. All her children are in primary school.

Mary is interested in organic palm oil farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through fair trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic palm oil field. This will help her fund her children’s education while developing a property that will also yield income in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic palm oil field

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified palm oil mill, and lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. She is 32 years old, and single with two children. Both her children attend primary school. 

Patience is interested in organic palm oil farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. She wants to secure a microloan so that she can expand her palm oil field, allowing her to fund her children's education and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her organic palm oil field

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr:
Liliane a 31 ans, célibataire et sans enfants. Elle gère actuellement son propre salon de coiffure. Elle possède quatre années d’expérience en la matière et elle a bien suivi une formation agrée avant d'ouvrir ce salon.
Elle a demandé un emprunt qu'elle utilisera pour acheter des matériels pour son salon de beauté.
Son objectif est d'augmenter le capital, pour pouvoir à en tirer beaucoup de bénéfices afin de réaliser son rêve d'ouvrir un jour une salle de fitness.
texts.en: Liliane is 31 years old, unmarried, and without children. She currently manages her own hair salon. She has four years of experience in this area and has indeed taken an approved training course before opening this salon. She asked for a loan that she will use to purchase some supplies and equipment for her beauty salon. Her goal is to increase her capital in order to make more profit, so as to realize her dream of opening a fitness center.

loans.use: to purchase a mirror, four plastic chairs, and a hair straightener

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is an accountant at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem district of Ghana's eastern region. He is 28 years old and single. 

Paul is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and improves his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. 

He wants to secure a micro loan to expand his oil palm field, allowing him to support his family for years to come.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. She is 54 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Nancy likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Nancy plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Nancy’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rexford

texts.en:
Rexford is a driver at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill. He also grows organic oil palms. 

He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 37 years old and married with four children, who attend primary school.

Rexford is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. 

He wants to secure a micro loan to expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is a branding officer and a supervisor at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill that grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 26 years old and single. 

Seth is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to support his family.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill. He also grows organic oil palms. 

He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. Richard is 42 years old and married with four children who attend school.

Richard is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. 

He wants to secure a micro loan to expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill who also grows organic oil palms. 

He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. Samuel is 28 years old and single with three children. All of his children attend primary school.

Samuel is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. 

He wants to secure a micro loan to expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill. He also grows organic oil palms. 

He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. Samuel is 46 years old and married with three children, all attend school.

Samuel is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. 

He wants to secure a micro loan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified palm oil mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 32 years old and single.

Seth is interested in organic oil parm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, giving him extra income to support his extended family.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill. She also grows organic oil palms. 

She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. Sandra is 31 years old and married with two children. Both her children are in primary school.

Sandra is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and helps develop her community through fair trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. 

Sandra wishes to secure a micro loan to expand her organic oil palm field. 

This will help her fund her children’s education while developing a property that will yield fruit for years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. 

He is 62 years old and married with nine children. Three of his children have graduated high school, and the others attend school.

Moses wants to secure a loan so he can expand his organic oil palm field. The additional income will allow him to continue providing for his family and fund his children’s education.

Moses believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a cheerful woman. She was born in a historical place where there are a lot of ancient ruins and beautiful nature scenes. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has one child. 

Rahima is hardworking, generous and talented person. She has 27 years experience of sewing traditional woman's dresses. She has permanent clients. She was one of the participants at a Start-up training provided by IMON. She understood how to use her gained knowledge and decided to start a business. 

She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy textiles and necessary items to sewing. She hopes to be supported, because her business will help her to earn money to make a living.

loans.use: to buy textiles and necessary items to do sewing.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis le 11 Décembre 2009, les femmes du B.V sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué. Elles ont comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 40 ans, célibataire et mère d’une fille. Elle a comme activité principale le cafeteria (vente de petit déjeuné). 

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 01 sac de sucre de 50 kg à 25000f, 01 bouteille de 20 litres  d’huile raffinée à 16500f et d’autre condiments pour les préparatifs du petit déjeuné et 01 frigo 250 000f  pour la vente de jus, de glace lors des marchés hebdomadaires.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de construire sa maison payer les soins médicaux et la scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en:
Created on 11th December 2009, the women of B.V are very close and are known for working together to develop a close group with a welcoming spirit.  Petty business is their main activity.

Aissatou (stood on the far right) is the borrower, she is 40 years old, single and the mother of one child.  Her main business is a café (selling breakfasts).

This new loan will enable her to buy: a 50kg bag of sugar for 25000f, one 20l bottle of refined cooking oil and some other condiments for 16500f for breakfast preparations and a fridge for 250 000f to sell juice and ice cream at the weekly market.

The profits will allow her to build a house, pay for medical care and her daughter's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a 50kg bag of sugar for 25000f, one 20l bottle of refined cooking oil and some other condiments for 16500f and a fridge for 250 000f to sell juice and ice cream.

loans.name: Lizelda

texts.en:
Lizelda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells commodities ranging from eggs, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and beverages.  She is a mother of five children ages 21- 5 years old respectively. She has been engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store for five years now. 

Lizelda is asking for a loan to purchase assorted grocery items.  This stock will improve the content of her store and attract more buyers to purchase. With this, her income will slowly augment and be able to handle her finances. She will be able to prepares nutritious meals for the whole family. Thus, she could do some expansion and start to save for the future. She is hoping that she can manage her business for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase assorted grocery items.

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony has worked as a driver for the past six years. He is single and lives in Siquijor. 

His business involves motors for hire and public transport. He does this work to support his needs and his parents' needs as well. 

Mark Anthony has asked for a loan to pay for the overhaul and maintenance of his motor unit. He wishes to own another unit to increase his income and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the overhaul and maintenance of his motor unit

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla was fortunate when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Priscilla started her hog raising business in Plaridel and it became profitable. This is how she supported her husband to sustain their needs. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional heads of piglets and build concrete pig pens. In the future, Priscilla hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living place.

loans.use: to purchase additional heads of piglets and build concrete pig pens.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora has a piggery business in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years old and has one child. She has been in her business for 5 years and her income supports her family. 

She has been a member of a multi-awarded cooperative named Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since 2009. 

She borrowed an amount of PHP 14,900 to build a concrete pig pen. Flora is thankful to PMPC for the help given.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda has switched from selling snacks to selling "tabliya" (processed cacao). Her business is doing well as she worked hard to perfect the quality of her "tabliya". With her husband's help and her children's support, she has maximized her profits and keep pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she availed herself of another loan from PMPC is to buy more kilos of raw and dried cacao seeds for her business. Today, Bernarda is able to help others do retailing business from her "tabliya" and they also earn money for their own family.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of raw and dried cacao seeds for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elena is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more items like footwear, blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell to customers.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like footwear, blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Josephine has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as pork skin, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Josephine has been in this business for nine years now. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as pork skin, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 26 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as soft drinks, milk, coffee, canned goods, spices, shampoo, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as soft drinks, milk, coffee, canned goods, spices, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
