As a married parent of two children, Leonisa works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Leonisa is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her motorcycle business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonisa is 48 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Leonisa has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Leonisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more banana fruits to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more banana fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 55 years old and married with four children. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, soft-drinks, coffee, cooking oil and other personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, soft-drinks, coffee, cooking oil and other personal care products.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Beverly is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Beverly has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Beverly requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Beverly has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Beverly would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Librada is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Librada has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Librada requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, spice, etc for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Librada has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, spice for her food production business.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Thanks to Mark's perseverance and courage, his household can have a respectable life. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. 

His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry, and some “side hustles" he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. 

The remote village of the Kimilili area has only one diesel posho (maize grinding) mill that serves a sea of people, but the mill keeps breaking down; hence, farmers are not able to grind their maize. 

Mark intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product “ugali“ (hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. 

Through this loan, Mark will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be history, because electric posho mills are more reliable. This loan will assist Mark to permanently change his life and achieve his life's mission of bringing economic development and poverty alleviation to communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Mark promises to fully repay on time. 

In the next two years, Mark sees himself as an established businessman who will be running more than one posho mill in his remote village. Mark patiently waits for your kindness. Kindly help him out!

loans.use: to buy a posho mill

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives with his wife in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. Karen has a higher pedagogical education and since 1999 until today he works at the school as a teacher of physical education.

Karen also has another occupation; he rents a hall in his city and there he is a coach of track and field. He has these trainings several times in a week and children come with great pleasure, and from a very young age they start to realize the importance of having a healthy lifestyle.

Karen’s pupils are of different ages and he works individually with each of them. He is sure in the near future one of them surely can become a good and famous sportsman. Karen says that it will be a great reward for him, since he works with great devotion and pleasure with each of his pupils.

With this loan in the amount of 700,000 Armenian drams, Karen plans to spend it on the purchase of sports equipment for his rented hall where he is having his trainings.

loans.use: to purchase sports equipment for his rented hall where he is having his training

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a mother of four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is mainly buying and selling cocoa. He gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business to get income; she works hard and has plans of expanding the cocoa business, but faces difficulties of high competition, price changes, and long distances to markets.  

She hopes to buy land and own large cocoa plantations in the future. Annet wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 35-year-old, married man with two children aged 8 and 6 years, living in Kasese, Uganda. David sells glasses and has been in that business for seven years. He gets additional income from farming. David has a dream of becoming rich and educating his children. However, market competition, accompanied by high license fees, are challenges to his business. David needs a loan to buy glasses for selling.

loans.use: to buy glasses to sell.

loans.name: Basema

texts.en:
Basema is 54 years old and lives in Wihdat. She is a mother of six children, and she wants to provide a comfortable life to them.

Her husband has a sewing shop, but his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of his big family. Here was the turn for Basema to think in a better way, to be a helpful and productive woman with willpower.

She started to help her husband in the sewing shop, and then she started her own business, which is selling clothes in her home. Basema did not lose any opportunity for success and helps her husband in all expenses.

Then she thought to use her talent in cooking. She started to cook in her home and sell the food, and she made a page on Facebook to achieve the largest number of customers possible. Actually, she is very good cooker.

Basema is working hard to improve her life and to reach her goals. She wants to increase her incomes; therefore she decided to expand her work. This decision led her to apply for a loan to buy more products to sell and buy supplies for cooking.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and buy supplies for cooking for her business.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 32-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Rose has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Rose described her harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a 39-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Eunice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Eunice described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Eunice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Johnstone's Group

texts.en:
Johnstone is 43 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Johnstone has been farming with One Acre Fund for 4 years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Johnstone also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Johnstone's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Silas's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Silas, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 33 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.  He is married and has 3 children.

Silas is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Silas says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Silas will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Ishmael's Group

texts.en:
Ishmael is a 48-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ishmael has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Ishmael described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, Ishmael’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. She is 52 years old, is married and has 9 children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 50-year-old old lady; she is living with her spouse, two daughters and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son is a turner by profession and manufactures spare parts for vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine has become out of order and some tools have become worn out due to continuously being used so they need to be replaced. He has spent his all savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have money to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Ishrat requested a loan for her son so that he can fix the lathe machine and can buy tools and dies. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her son can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix a lathe machine, tools and dies.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. He is 46 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Joseph likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to save more money. Joseph plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Joseph’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Jane, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 49 years old, is married and has 4 children. Jane has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Jane isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Jane will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jane's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena, 39, is a responsible mother who lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC and the first with Kiva. 

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and other items. He purchases scrap goods from the common people and sells them to recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have cash in hand to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to generate money.

Therefore, Ameena requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and wishes to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Ameena's husband purchase scrap goods to resell to recycling factories.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is a 39-year-old woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. 

He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Aneela has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. 

Aneela is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase a new rickshaw body and seat covers.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Hồng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Hồng is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old divorced mother of 2 children for whom she works hard to provide with the best education and standard of living. Since she was divorced in 2011, she has been working as an Accountant to cover their increasing needs.

Mariam's limited monthly salary can barely cover her children's needs. For this reason, she is acquiring her second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's increasing tuition fees.

Mariam's previous loan was invested in the same way, and she hopes to stay capable of covering her children's educational expenses, so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay her children's increasing tuition fees.

loans.name: Trị

texts.en:
Trị works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Trị is 60 years old and she is married with two children. She lives  in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Trị joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Trị has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Trị Nguyễn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Trị hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dulce Nombre Group

texts.es: El grupo “Dulce Nombre” se encuentra conformado por cuatro socios que tomaron la decisión de trabajar juntas, ya que viven en la misma zona y tiene como meta en común incrementar el capital de trabajo para ofrecer mejores condiciones a su familia, la coordinadora del grupo es la señora María que tiene la edad de 24 años y quien tiene el negocio de venta de tortilla, frijoles cosidos y leña, negocio en el cual tiene cinco años de experiencia y demuestra la madures adquirida al poseer su propio negocio, es madre soltera de tres hijos de las edades de 7, 5 y 2 años de edad, por quienes busca la superación personal y del negocio, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en quintal de maíz, frijol y flete de leña, con el crédito anterior ha logrado mantener el negocio , ya que es el que le permite obtener los ingresos para brindarles los recursos básicos a su familia. Las otras integrantes que conforman este grupo son, Martiza una señora de 49 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años, María Magdalena una joven de 22 años que se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos y ropa de manera ambulante en los al rededores de su comunidad, y la señora María Eugenia de 44 años de edad quien es costurera y ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group "Dulce Nombre" is made up of four members who made the decision to work together because they live in the same area and they have a common purpose in terms of wanting to increase their earnings in order to provide their families with better living conditions. 

The group's coordinator is María who is 24 years old and works selling tortillas, beans and firewood. She has been doing this for five years and shows her maturity that she has gained through owing her own business. She is a single mother with three children aged 7, 5 and 2 years old, for whom she is looking to help get ahead along with her business. She is asking for the loan to buy a quintal of corn, beans and a load of firewood. With her previous loan she managed to stay in business as the loan allowed her to earn enough to provide her family with basic resources. 

The other members of the group are Martiza who is 49 years old and has owned a local convenience store for three years, María Magdalena a young woman of 22 years old who sells cosmetics and clothing at local markets and María Eugenia who is 44 years old and a seamstress who also sells food from her house.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn, beans and a load of firewood.

loans.name: Baraléndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 17 Mai 2010.Les membres habitent dans le même village et ont une bonne attente.

Astou l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 47 ans.Elle est marié et mère d'un garçon.Elle est debout à droite de la photo en levant sa main gauche.

Elle fait du commerce de tissu.Avec son prêt,elle va acheter du tissu wax à 200000fcfa,6 pièces de tissu voile à 16000fcfa l'unité,du tissu basin à 102000fcfa et du tissu Khartoum à 95000fcfa.

Avec les bénéfices,elle va renforcer son épargne ,cotiser la tontine et appuyer son mari.
texts.en:
This group has been created on May 17, 2010. The group members live in the same village and have good rapport.
Astou, our star borrower, is 47 years old. She is married and has a son. She is the one standing on the right in the photo raising her left hand.
Astou sells fabric. With her loan she will buy traditional wax fabric at 200,000 West African francs, six sets of lightweight voile fabric at 16,000 francs per set, some  damask-type “basin” fabric at 102,000 francs and “Khartoum” printed fabric at 95,000 francs. With her revenues, she will bolster her savings, make contributions to the “tontine” [neighborhood savings group] and help her husband with expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Niña is a married woman with two children from Antequera, Bohol. Her children are aged 12 and 11 years old. She is engaged in producing native baskets to earn a living. Her husband has an income that helps defray the family's expenses.

She is asking for a loan to purchase materials like buli (palm), nito (a kind of fern, whose stem is used for basket weaving), and oway (a kind of rope used to bind in basket weaving). These  materials are very essential in producing more baskets to sell. With these, she will be able to gain a higher income and slowly improve the family's living condition.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like buli (palm) and nito (a kind of  fern).

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna engages in weaving and selling of native baskets made of palm. She is 31 years old, a married woman with a nine-year-old daughter 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like wicker (woven fiber formed into a rigid material), buli (palm) and nito (a kind of fern whose stems are used for weaving baskets).  These  materials are very useful in producing more baskets. Thus, Edna will be able to start to handle her finances and able to pay her obligations. 

In the future, Edna hopes that she could properly handle her current business so it is productive.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving like wicker, buli and nito.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna had a small piggery business until she became a boss with her own meat shop. She has managed to have enough meat supplies for her shop and rolls up her capital to gain more profits. Every day she makes good sales because of her good selling skills. 

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena has a passion for selling. She has a sari-sari store business in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 38 years old and is happily married with three children. Her growing business gives her an income that finances the studies of her children. 

Since 2012, Lorena has been a member of PMPC with good standing. She borrowed an amount of PHP 10,000 to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items in her business.  Indeed, Lorena is fortunate enough to be part of PMPC family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Famita

texts.en:
In 2013, Famita learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to business start-ups. 

Famita tried her luck on starting a business focusing on hog raising. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Famita has taken another loan to purchase 5 piglet for commercial sale. This will help her earn and save more money for her family. 

Famita continuously looks for better business opportunities, and she would love to engage in other business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase 5 piglets for commercial sale.

loans.name: Michille

texts.en:
Michille works hard to support her family. Michille is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Michille requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, flour, cooking oil and other utensils for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Michille has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, flour, cooking oil and other utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 58 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Ester has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, diapers and other groceries.

Ester has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, diapers, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Merry Joy

texts.en:
Merry Joy is 30 years old and married with four children. With one child is still in school, Merry Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Merry Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell such as milk, coffee, sugar, spices, canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Merry Joy has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell such as milk, coffee, sugar, spices, canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is 69 years old, married with four children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Eveline has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal  for ten years and also earns an income from selling fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Salvaminda

texts.en:
Salvaminda is 35 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school. Salvaminda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, coconut wine, home care products, and other groceries.

Salvaminda has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Salvaminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, coconut wine, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teresa is 48 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Teresa has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy different kinds of fruits to sell on her fruit stall like banana, mango, apple, pineapple, water melon, etc. 

Teresa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruit like banana, mango, apple, pineapple, water melon, to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teresa is 35 years old and has five children who are presently in school.

Teresa has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits like bananas, mangoes, apples, oranges and etc to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits like bananas, mangoes, apples, oranges to sell.

loans.name: Monena

texts.en:
Monena is 38 years old and married with three children. With her all of her children presently in school, Monena works very hard to provide for them.

Monena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Monena has been in this business for nine years.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ainea's Group

texts.en:
Ainea is 51 years old and is often referred to as a really friendly person. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Matete District, formed by 14 farmers, including himself.

Ainea has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2010 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also two solar lights in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Ainea’s Group will receive a total of 15 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José es un productor de plátano, un hombre muy trabajador, ama mucho a su familia, tiene dos hijos la mayor de 12 años y el menor de 8, ambos estudian, José algunos días de la semana les pide que lo acompañe al campo para enseñarles todo acerca de la profesión, quiere convertir esta forma de vida de la agricultura en una tradición familiar que trascienda y supere dificultades.

José tiene dos sueños básicamente uno de ellos poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ambos sueños los quiere lograr en base al trabajo, al cultivo de plátano.

La falta de capital ha sido un impedimento en la búsqueda de un aumento de producción y de ventas, pero no se puede convertir en una excusa existiendo excelente proyectos como Kiva, quien con sus miles de beneficiaros dan un granito de arena para que los empresarios progresen.

José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la preparación y mantenimiento de las tierras, abonos,  gallinaza, fungicidas son los productos que comprara junto con la construcción de canales de riegos.
texts.en:
José is a plantain grower and a hardworking man who loves his family. He has two sons, ages 12 and 8, both in school. A couple days a week, José asks them to come with him to the farm so that he can teach them everything about his work. He wants to make his farming way of life into a family tradition that both transcends and overcomes difficulties.

José has two simple goals: to pay for his children's education and to improve his family's living conditions. He plans to achieve both goals through hard work growing plantain.

A lack of capital has been an impediment in his quest to expand production and sales, but it's not an excuse thanks to the existence of such excellent projects as Kiva, where millions of donors each give a little bit so that small businesses can flourish.

José is requesting this loan so that he can buy supplies to prepare and maintain his land, including manure, hen droppings, and fungicides; he also intends to pay for the construction of irrigation canals.

loans.use: maintain and prepare his land as well as build irrigation canals

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 37 years old.

Zenaida has a business selling fruit in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan, who is a 36-year-old married man, lives in a small village named Ochkhamuri. He lives with his wife, two daughters and mother-in-law. To take care of the family’s everyday needs, Levan and his family members are engaged in cattle and milk-cow breeding, and in cultivation of nuts and maize. He realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

As it has become harder to earn a living over time, Levan wants to expand his business activity in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of 2,900 GEL will be a great support to this hardworking man and his family, enabling him to purchase all needed equipment and open a car-wash service. He will have his own loyal customers and generate significant income. Levan and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to open a car-wash service and get significant income.

loans.name: Zainabu's Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 59 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Zainabu has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to send her children to school and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Zainabu also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Zainabu's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is living in a rural area of Kratie province. She is a mother of three children and she is aged 25 years old. Her family are dependent on potato and rice farming to make a living. She has been doing this for seven years and it earns her about 62,000 KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group, applying for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees. She hopes to improve her living conditions by expanding her current business.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is a 42-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Lilian has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Lilian described her harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Lilian’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nelly's Group

texts.en:
Nelly is a 32-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader who is often described as a very trustworthy person, and she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Nelly has noticed that she has gained a lot of respect in her community.

Nelly described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to the fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Nelly’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sreymech's Group

texts.en:
Sreymech, 21, is a married mother of one child, living in Mondulkiri province. Growing potatoes and selling grocery items have been the sources of her family’s income for a few years. 

She is now leading a group of two to apply for this loan. With her portion, she will buy more grocery items for sale. She hopes that she can earn more income and have a better life style.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 8 farmers in Matete District. He is 66 years old, is married and has 9 children.

Patrick likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Patrick plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Patrick’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Yot's Group

texts.en:
Yot is 45 years old and she is a mother of three dependent children. She is a resident in a rural area of Kampong Thom province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and working for other farms for a fee. She has been doing this around 19 years. She can earn around 40,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

This is the first loan with VisionFund for her group, which consists of six members. Yot is leading the group to borrow this loan, with her portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have good health and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Neneng. Neneng lives in North Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Neneng lives there with her husband and her children (one son and one daughter). Neneng owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to expand her business in another sector, which is technology.

As the business grows, Neneng needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Neneng’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Neneng is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits services for her community.

loans.name: Mwambiliilyo Wa Maundu W.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Catherine, 45 years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from the training offered by the HiH EA mainly on savings, enterprise development and financial management. 

Currently, she supplies cereals to schools. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more cereals such as maize, beans and pigeon peas, hence increase stock and earn more income to enable her to pay for quality education for her children.
 
Catherine is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more cereals such as maize, beans and pigeon peas, hence increase stock and earn more income to enable her to pay for quality education for her children.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is the age of 29, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband constructs concrete floors and polishes marble floors. For this purpose, he uses basic tools to align smoothness and a floor polishing machine. He has been providing these services for many years. 

A few days ago his polishing machine became out of order due to continuous use. For this is reason, he wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand. Therefore, Mariyam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy a new polishing machine and can continue his services.

loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing a floor polishing machine.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
John un joven de 24 años de edad, padre de una hija de 3 años, trabajador, perseverante, que busca alternativas para generar ingresos, su actividad principal es la venta de ganado, lo que se puede apreciar en la foto son sus hermosos y bien tenidos terrenos y uno de sus animales.

John inició su actividad como independiente en el año 2005, cuando aún era menor de edad, pero este increíble chico se las ha arreglado para competir y no dejarse absorber de la competencia que son personas mayores con una gran conocimiento empírico sobre mercadeo.

Su sueño es tener una vivienda propia, construirá en material y madera, trabaja muy duro para lograrlo.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo, para invertir en la compra de una podadora, la razón es que quiere realizar el mismo el mantenimiento a sus terreno, y poder ser contratado por otras personas, ese capital de más le ayudaría mucho para alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en:
John, age 24, is the father of a three-year-old daughter. He is hard-working and persevering and currently in search of alternative ways to earn money. His main line of work is selling cattle. You can see in the picture his lovely, well-tended lands and one of his animals.

John started his independent business in 2005, while he was still a minor. This incredible young man has made it so that he can compete and and not get absorbed by the competition, usually older people with long understanding about the market.

His goal is to have his own home, built from wood and solid materials; he works very hard to achieve this goal.

His is requesting this loan so that he can buy a mower. He wants to do his own maintenance on his land and he could be hired by other people as well. The capital from the loan will help him a lot in achieving his dream.

loans.use: buy a mower so that he can maintain his own land and sell his services to others.

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es: Maria, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 11 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá junto a tres de sus hijos y dos nietos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al hogar y a la agricultura. Sus cultivos son la papa, maíz y el frijol, el cual vende  en la misma zona en el mercado local.  Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 6,000 lempiras, para compra de abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos de papas y frijol. Ella tiene como meta seguir mejorando el cultivo para mejorar su condición de vida y mejorar su casa. Este prestamo es el tercer ciclo con la institución  y es en forma grupal. El grupo se llama Mujeres en Marcha, integrado por dos miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y residen en la misma zona. El prestamo grupal es por 7,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fungicidas para aplicar  a sus cultivos. En la foto a la izquierda esta Mirna y a la derecha Maria.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and single because she is widowed. She has eleven children and lives in a village in the municipality of Intibucá with three of her children and two grandchildren. All her life, she has been a housewife and a farmer. Her crops are potatoes, corn, and beans, which she sells in the same area in the local market. 

Maria decided to request a loan of 7,000 lempiras [HNL] in order to buy fertilizer and fungicides for her potato and bean crops. Her goal is to continue improving her crops in order to improve her living conditions and her house.

This loan is Maria's third with the institution and it is in group form. The group loan is for 7,000 lempiras in order to buy fertilizer and fungicides to apply to her crops. In the photo, Mirna is on the left and Maria is on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide for her potato and bean crops.

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
Yoem has been a rice farmer for thirty years, living in Kampong Thom province, in Cambodia.  She is 55 years old and a mother of seven children, with two of them attending school. She earns about 43,000 KHR per day. 

Yoem really needs a small amount of money to buy a decent latrine for family use, and leads her group of three members to apply for the loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  

She hopes that all of her family members will have good health and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny is living in a rural area of Kratie Province. She is a mother of four children, and she is 41 years old. Her family’s living has depended on potato farming on four hectares of farmland and also paid work for other farms for seven years. Her activities earn her about 69,000 KHR per day. 

Now Vanny is leading a group, applying for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to buy farming supplies to support her farming. She hopes to improve her living condition by expanding her current business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group lives in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Sok works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Proeung's Group

texts.en:
Proeung is 48 years old, and she is a mother of five children. She is a resident in a rural area of Kampong Thom Province. The source of her family’s income has been from rice farming and working for other farms for more than ten years. She can earn around 59,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

This is the first loan with VisionFund for her group, which consists of four members. Now, she is leading the group to borrow this loan, with her portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have good health and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Teresia, 60 years old and a mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2013. She does maize and bean farming. 

Teresia is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) for the enterprise training. She is borrowing from Kiva to start a cereals business which is in high demand. She hopes to earn more income to enable her to educate her children and meet other family needs.

Teresia is happy with Kiva and their lenders for the support and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cereals that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Kasambara Bidii Horticulture Unit Shg Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Kasambara Bidii Horticulture Unit SHG Group. She is 46 years old, married and a mother of six children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in September 2014.

Jane farms maize, beans and poultry.  Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she is now able to manage her farming business well and profitably.  She is obtaining a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer in hopes of producing a good harvest and higher income from the sale of her farm produce.  This will enable her support her children's education and provide for other family needs.

She is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Her name is Miriam. She is 41 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Miriam is married to Eddie, a construction worker. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs. 

Miriam operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all of the products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also makes peanut butter and sells it at her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and soda which she sells at retail price. Part of the loan she will use to buy peanuts, oil, sugar and containers to make peanut butter for sale. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return on her investment, as it will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Miriam hopes to buy her own "gilingan" (equipment to grind peanuts). She dreams of owning a house and living a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and beverages to sell at her store, and to pay for peanuts, containers and oil to make her peanut butter for sale.

loans.name: Dayle

texts.es:
Daily es un mujer trabajadora independiente de 30 años de edad, que se centra en la venta de carne y la venta de productos como ropa y ventas por catálogo, una actividad algo dificultosa para las personas del campo debido a los largos desplazamientos que deben realizar no solo para vender si no para comprar mercancía.

Ella tiene toda su mercancía en una parte de su hogar en la foto podemos ver los productos que vende como lociones, cremas de manos, productos capilares y faciales entre otros, de igual manera una báscula donde pesa la carne que vende.

Daily necesita mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, consolidarse más en su vereda, competir con los almacenes de ropa, diversificar su venta para atraer persona, todo ello porque desea tener algún día un local propio, mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda y pagar la educación de su hija de 14 años de edad que está próxima a celebrar sus 15 años un evento muy especial en donde sus padres realizan un gran esfuerzo por darle una buena celebración.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para hombre y mujer y productos de catálogo.
texts.en:
Daily, age 30, is a hard-working, independent woman. She primarily sells meat and also products such as clothing and catalog items. It's a difficult line of work for people out in the country due to the long distances they have to cover not only to sell but also to buy their merchandise.

She keeps all her merchandise in a part of her home. In the photo, we can see the products she sells, including lotions, hand cream, hair and facial products, and more. On the top shelf is the scale where she weighs the meat she sells.

Daily needs to improve her sales; expand her customer base; become more established on her street; compete with clothing stores; and diversify her sales to attract more people. All of this because she wants to one day run a store of her own, improve her living conditions, and pay for the education of her 14-year-old daughter. Next year, her daughter will celebrate her 15th birthday, which is a very special occasion that her parents will work very hard to make a nice celebration.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy men's and women's clothing and products from catalogs.

loans.use: expand her business selling clothing and catalog-based personal care items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 45 años de edad dedicada a la venta de productos para el hogar, como acolchados, ollas, vasos, platos, porcelana, sombreros, poncheras, calzado, combustible para molinos entre otros, ella inicio la actividad por gusto al trabajo independiente, ella tiene dos grandes y gracias a su actividad puede generar el ingreso para su familia conformada por 3 consentidas mujeres.

María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de acolchados y combustible para molino, su producto estrella.

Apoya a esta mujer que se atrevió a hacer algo diferente a innovar en el campo y darles una solución a necesidades que le pueden surgir y que para suplirlas deben acudir al pueblo o la ciudad.
texts.en:
María, age 45, is in the business of selling household products, such as cushions, pots, vases, plates, dishes, hats, party bowls, shoes, and fuel for grain mills, among others. She began this business because she liked to work independently. She has two grown children and thanks to her work, she is able to generate the income to support her family, comprised of three spoiled ladies.

María is requesting this loan so that she can stock her business with cushions and fuel for grain mills, which is her number one product.  Support this woman who dared to something different to innovate in the countryside, providing people with a solution to the necessities that arise; without her, her customers would have to turn to the nearby town or city.

loans.use: stock her store with cushions and fuel for grain mills, for which she is the sole local supplier

loans.name: Jonessa

texts.en:
Jonessa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Jonessa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jonessa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has two children who are in school. Laila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Laila has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Agnes from Nakuru, Kenya. She is 52 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in February 2013. Agnes operates a food and charcoal selling business. She has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HiH EA) which has enabled her acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more charcoal stock. This will increase her income through which she will educate her children, provide medical care and other family needs. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to boost sales, and thus make more income.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean est un père de famille responsable, impliqué dans son affaire depuis pas mal de temps.Il vend des bidons, des fûts, des sceaux de peintures, des bouteilles en plastiques usés depuis 1992. C'est une activité qui lui est transmis par ses parents. C'était et encore avec les gains tirés de cette activité qu'il a pu et continue encore supporter sa famille. Elle bénéficie l'appui de sa femme dans l'exercice de cette activité.
Il a demandé un crédit afin de mieux ravitailler ses stocks, car il a des clients en province qui lui envoient régulièrement des commandes toutes les  deux semaines.
Il a 50 ans et a six enfants dont le dernier seulement va à l' école actuellement. Les restes sont déjà majeurs et n'habitent plus avec lui.
texts.en:
Jean is a responsible father who has been involved in his commercial activity for quite some time. He has been selling jugs, barrels, paint buckets and used plastic bottles since 1992. He learned this business from his parents; this is how he has been able to support his family, and still does to this day. He runs this activity with the benefit of his wife’s help. 

He is seeking this loan to stock up on merchandise, as some of his customers from remote areas send in orders every two weeks. 

Jean is a 50-year-old father of six children. The youngest still goes to school, while the others are already of age and no longer live with him.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jugs and barrels for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Gladys, from Nakuru, Kenya. She is 35 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in January 2013. Gladys practices poultry keeping. She has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HiH EA) which has enabled her to acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase additional poultry. This will increase her income, and thus, she will educate her children, provide medical care, and other family needs. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support, and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks that will boost farming.

loans.name: Ayub's Group

texts.en:
Ayub is a 37-year-old, proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ayub has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Ayub described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Ayub’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Silvia Cristina

texts.es: Silvia de 39 años de edad vive en una pequeña vivienda que es propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 7 años en su lugar de residencia con la que sustenta las necesidades del hogar su esposo trabaja con una empresa constructora como jardinero con lo que aporta a los gastos de su hogar. Anteriormente ella adquirió un crédito con FUSAI con el cual pudo construir el cuarto que deseaban para remplazar el que tenía el cual estaba construido de madera pero este aún está incompleto ellos unieron esfuerzos para poder ir pagando al día su crédito. Ahora ella está solicitando a FUSAI un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en: cemento, arena y balcones para encementar el piso e instalar balcones en el cuarto que construyeron y de esta manera ver terminado uno de sus grandes sueños y así tener una mejor calidad de vida y evitar las filtraciones durante la lluvia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 39 years old and lives in a small residence of her own with her partner and 6 year old son. She's had a small store for 7 years in her residence with which she has met her household's needs, and her husband works for a construction company as a gardener and uses that job to help pay for household expenses. 

Previously she received a loan through FUSAI that enabled her to build a room that they wanted to replace the one they had, which was built out of wood. It's still incomplete however so they combined their efforts to keep up with the loan payments. Now she's applying for a new loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, and balconies to pave the floor and install balconies in the room they built, so that they can see one of their biggest dreams come true and have a higher standard of living and prevent the rain from leaking in.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, and balconies to pave the floor and install balconies in the room.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz,trigo y quinua,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,trigo y quinua.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This group member, Bernardina, is still working in the sale of dry grains like corn, wheat, and quinoa. Through these means she wants to support her family, and her dream is to expand her grain selling business. She's applying for a loan to purchase corn, wheat, and quinoa. 

This group member is happy because of the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase corn, wheat, and quinoa.

loans.name: Iries

texts.en:
Iries is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Iries successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Iries's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa works hard to support her family. Nicolasa is married and has a retail fruits business in the Philippines.

Nicolasa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits such as mangoes, bananas, apples, oranges, and others to sell.

Nicolasa has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits such as mangoes, bananas, apples, oranges to sell

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 51 years old and married with eight children. With three children who are still in school, Presentacion works very hard to provide for them.

Presentacion runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Presentacion has been in this business for 14 years.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: Manyurba est commerçante, présidente da la banque villageoise «Esperance», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 42 ans, mariée à un déclarant en douane, mère de 9 enfants, dont 7 étudient et 2 sont deja grands. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis 24 ans. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Manyurba, age 42, is a merchant and president of the Esperance village bank. She is a client of the Hekima MFI. She is married to a customs broker and they have nine children, seven of them in school and the other two already grown up. 

Her husband initially gave her the funds to launch her business. She has been selling used shoes at the downtown market for 24 years. She plans to buy 10 bales of shoes. 

Her goals are to build a house, to feed her children and to support their studies. 

She thanks Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who can’t use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 10 bales of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero, vive básicamente de lo que produce como comerciante, tiene gran amor y cariño por los animales, realizo algunos estudios para entender ciertos comportamientos y reacciones, también se especializo en el corte, lavado, y manicure de los amigos peludos.

Gracias a este conocimiento que ya o tiene muy preparado Jorge quiere renunciar de su vida como comerciante para iniciar su propio negocio de salón de belleza para mascotas, un proyecto muy ambicioso que requiere de mucha inversión en infraestructura, por lo que necesita un monto considerable de dinero que de momento no cuenta.

Jorge conoce muy bien las barreras que tiene en el momento, pero no se rendirá ante la situación sabe que hay maneras de lograr su objetivo, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar formalmente con su negocio de salón de belleza para mascotas.

El monto lo invertirá de la siguiente manera, implementos de peluquería, tener una pet store, muebles y enseres, adecuaciones locativas, uniformes publicidad.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 28, is single and lives simply from what he earns in business. He loves animals, and studied some to understand certain behaviors and reactions they have. He also specializes in washing, trimming, and doing the nails of his furry friends.

Thanks to all this understanding and experience, Jorge is well prepared to give up his life as a businessman to start his own business running a beauty salon for pets. It's an ambitious project that will require a lot of investment in infrastructure and require a considerable sum of money that he does not, at the moment, have.

Jorge understands very well the obstacles he faces at the moment, but he is not giving up because he knows that there are ways to achieve his goal. He is requesting this loan to do just that: to allow him to formally start his beauty salon for pets.

The money requested will be used to purchase a pet store, furniture and basic necessities, barber's tools, and uniforms as well as to make any needed improvements and repairs to the purchased location.

loans.use: get his new business - a beauty salon for pets - off the ground

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, and is being represented by Emily who is the group leader, pictured above. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Emily has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Emily isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Emily will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Emily's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mithu Learning Centre S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photograph is Monicah, 46 years old, a mother of six children, and a member of Mithu Learning Centre S.h.g Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

She buys and sells chickens and eggs to earn an income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chickens in order to increase her stock and increase sales of eggs and chickens.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens in order to increase her stock and increase sales of eggs and chickens.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun is living in a rural area of Kratie Province. She is a mother of four children, and she is 52 years old. Her family’s living has depended on potato farming and working for other farms for 32 years, and it earns her about 62,000 KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group, applying for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to buy farming supplies to support her farming. She hopes to improve her living condition by getting more yields and expanding her current business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. She is 54 years old, married and has five children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate eight acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvest of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, tomato paste, and smoked fish

loans.name: Marcos William

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucalá, una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, cuneta con 2 mototaxis que le permiten brindar este servicio, tiene experiencia en este negocio y buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones y arreglos a sus vehículos ya que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado, con esto el espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos is 38 years old and he is in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own home along with his daughter in the district of Pucalá, a community that works mostly in business, farming and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living offering transportation services on his motorcycle taxi. He has two motorcycle taxis that allow him to offer this service. He has experience in this business as well as good references in his area. 

He will use the loan to do repairs and alterations on his vehicles, since they are currently in bad shape. He hopes to give his customers the best service, which will generate a larger income and he will finally be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to do repairs and alterations on his vehicles, since they are currently in bad shape.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase modern soap

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 35 años de edad, es separado, vive con sus padres en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y comercio que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en el distrito de Cayaltí y zonas cercanas, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 6 años. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y arreglos a su mototaxi ya que se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera el espera mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes lo que le permitirá obtener más ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
