Jorge is 35 years old, separated, and lives with his parents in a house of their own in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti, a community that's dedicated to agriculture and commerce and is located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

He works in transportation services in the Cayalti district and adjacent areas, and has been doing this job for 6 years. He's requesting a loan to pay for repairs on his motor taxi because it's in bad condition. With this he's hoping to improve the service he provides to his customers, which would allow him to earn more income and improve he and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for repairs on his motor taxi because it's in bad condition.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is a 58-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Silveria has a retail fruit business in the Philippines. Silveria requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits such as bananas, coconuts, mangoes, watermelon and others to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Silveria has been in this business for 31 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits such as bananas, coconuts, mangoes, watermelon and others to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Antonia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Antonia has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: A sus  63 años de edad Magdalena esta casada, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, el esposo de magdalena es agricultor y jornalero. Magdalena vive con su esposo y 2  nietos a los que cuida mientras la madre de los niños trabaja, Magdalena se dedica  a la crianza de animales, Magdalena necesita el dinero del credito para comprar una vaca ya que comenta que con la venta de leche es como obtiene sus ingresos, Magdalena tiene la aspiracion de comprar mas vacas y tener mayores ingresos  y asi apoyar a su hija y sus nietos.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Magdalena is married and has two grown children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer and a day laborer.

Magdalena lives with her husband and takes care of two of her grandchildren while their mother is at work. She raises animals and needs a loan in order to buy a cow. Magdalena says that she will sell the milk in order to generate income. Her aspiration is to buy more cows and have more income so that she can support her daughter and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Florence is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by ten farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Florence started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and she decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Florence’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old, married with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Elsa requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zaynie

texts.en:
Zaynie is a 46-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Zaynie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Zaynie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Zaynie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Zaynie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Saram's Group

texts.en:
Saram, 45, is a married woman. She lives in a rural area of Kampong Thom province. Her family’s living has depended on rice farming and working for other farms for twenty-five years.

Now she is leading a group, applying for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for her family’s use. She hopes that her all family members will have good health and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Unn's Group

texts.en:
Unn has been a rice farmer for ages and fishing is an additional source of income for her family, living in Kampong Thom province. She is 58 years old and a mother of two children. 

Now Unn really needs a small amount of money to buy a decent latrine for her family's use. So she leads her group of five members to apply for the loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She hopes that her all family members will have good health and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Phen has been a rice farmer for more than five years, living in Kampong Thom province. She is 48 years old and a mother of three children, and two of them are in school. She can earn about 51,000 KHR per day. 

Now Phen really needs a small amount of money to buy a decent latrine for her family's use. So she leads her group of three members to apply for the loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She hopes that her all family members will have good health and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet is 34 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Linet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Linet also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Linet's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom’s Group lives in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. 

Rom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does work as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ahliba

texts.fr: Ahliba Akpédjé une femme de 54ans a pour mari un missionnaire. Ils ont 03 enfants en charge. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du ménages, elle revend du vin, de la boisson et de l'eau dans une boutique louée à cet effet. Son approvisionnement se fait au Grand Marché de Lomé. Manquant de fonds pour acheter plus de marchandises, elle sollicite un second prêt à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. A l'avenir, elle souhaite augmenter son stock et subvenir pleinement aux besoins de la famille. Ahliba a 05ans d'ancienneté dans l'activité.
texts.en: Ahliba Akpédjé is a 54-year-old woman, and her husband is a missionary. They have three children to support. To provide a lot of help to her husband in covering household expenses, Ahliba Akpédjé sells wine, beverages, and water at a store leased for this purpose. Her supplies are gotten at the Grand Market of Lomé. Lacking funds for purchasing more merchandise, she is requesting a second loan at WAGES to achieve her goal. For the future, she would like to increase her inventory and fully meet family needs. Ahliba Akpédjé has five years of seniority in this business.

loans.use: to purchase wine, beverages, and water

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi un jeune homme de 33ans est revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 2012. Son second crédit lui servira d'acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite réinvestir dans son activité en ouvrant une boutique et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Yaovi is a young man, 33 years old, who has been a retailer of spare parts since 2012. His second loan will be used to purchase merchandise in order to meet customer needs. He would like to reinvest in his business by opening a shore and to do better at covering his expenses.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi, 37ans est marié avec un enfant de 06ans en charge. Il est revendeur de friperie. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter des friperies et réinvestir les bénéfices afin d'agrandir son activité. A l'avenir, il souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de toute la famille.
texts.en: Kossi, aged 37, is married and has a 6-year-old child to support. He is a retailer of secondhand clothing. He is requesting a loan to purchase some used clothing and to reinvest the profits, so as to expand his business. For the future, he would like to expand his business and ensure his entire family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Helen has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Helen has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 36 years old and married. He lives in Khornabuji. He and his wife are involved in a small agricultural activity. They cultivate land and harvest wheat seasonally. Albert works at the distribution service and earns a fixed salary. 

In order to achieve financial stability and increase his monthly income, Albert decided to start dairy farming and requested credit among local financial institutions, but his request was rejected several times. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to receive a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to receive a loan for 3,500 GEL, which he will use for purchasing three milk cows. After the purchase, the family will start producing dairy products, such as cheese and yogurt, to sell. They will also use the milk products for family feeding.

loans.use: to purchase three milk cows

loans.name: Humberto Segundo

texts.es:
Desde 1990 el señor Humberto se lanzó al mundo del emprendimiento, cuando gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre inicio con su negocio de plantación de plátano, tiene más de 200 palos plantados en su territorio y agradece a las personas que lo han apoyado con préstamos, con ideas, con trabajo porque es por ellos que hoy puede contar con más de 25 años de trayectoria en el mercado, esperando que sea mucho más y devolver la importancia al gremio de agricultores que tanto se ha perdido por la imagen que tienen ante los demás como seres del campo sin educación.
 
Humberto busca ser un hombre exitoso, tener cada día más cultivos, incluso planta semillas que saben que demorara años en crecer y ser rentables, pero este lindo legado y territorio le puede quedar a alguien y no es una persona egoísta.

Apoyar personas como Humberto vale la pena por su progreso, por su corazón, y ahora Humberto se encuentra nuevamente pidiendo ayuda para comprar insumos agrícolas como lo son gallinaza, mallas para proteger cultivos, abonos, pesticidas, insecticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en:
In 1990 Humberto launched into the world of entrepreneurship. Thanks to his father's teachings, he started his own banana plantation, and he now has over 200 trees planted on his property. Humberto is very grateful to all the people who helped along the way with loans, ideas, work and other support. 

Today Humberto has over 25 years working in this sector, he is hopeful that in the future the importance of agriculture workers will be restored, as often agriculture workers are looked down upon as uneducated country folk. 

Humberto is looking to become a successful man, every day his crops grow. He plants seeds that he knows will take years to grow and become profitable. However this beautiful land belongs to a humble and unselfish man. 

Supporting people like Humberto is worthwhile because of he has heart, he is progressing. Humberto is once again asking for support to buy supplies to protect his crops such as fertilizer, pesticide, insecticide and fungicide.

loans.use: to buy supplies to protect his crops such as fertilizer, pesticide, insecticide and fungicide.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Fely has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Fely has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
Saúl, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado; en el año 2014 formalizó la relación sentimental que tenia desde hace 9 años y se casó con la madre de sus dos niñas.- Su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y las niñas a estudiar en la escuela.

Saúl, desde pequeño ha trabajado en las labores del campo, cultivando maíz y hortalizas. Actualmente, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas ponedores en pequeñas cantidades, sin embargo también siembra pipían y maíz para consumo y para la venta.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar una cerda que le están vendiendo y para comprar alimentación para el resto de sus animales, puesto que algunas se encuentran en etapa de gestación y necesitan comer más de lo normal.

Saúl, siempre ha soñado con llegar a tener su propia granja de cerdos y que sea grande y próspera.
texts.en:
Saúl is 33 years old and studied up to Grade 1. In 2014 he formalized a romantic relationship that has been going on for 9 years and married the mother of his two children. His wife does housework and his children go to school.

Saúl since he was young has worked in the field growing corn and vegetables. Currently he works raising pigs and laying hens in small quantities. However he still grows squash and corn for his own consumption and to sell.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a pig that is being offered to him and feed for the rest of his animals. Some of them are pregnant and need to eat more than normal. Saúl has always dreamed of having his own pig farm that is large and prosperous.

loans.use: to buy a pig that has been offered to him and feed for the rest of his animals.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 33-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in the Matete District in Kenya. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Ruth has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Ruth described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Ruth’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Sindy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Sindy is 38 years old and a mother of five children. She grows potatoes to earn income to support her family’s living condition.

This is Sindy’s first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get this loan. With her portion, she will buy seed and pay for the plowing fee.

She hopes that she can get more income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Koeu's Group

texts.en:
Koeu’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Koeu makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a seller to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Talleristas Del Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TALLERSTAS DEL NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de faldas, venta de chalecos, venta de chamarras.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana, quien tenía el mismo negocio y ella le ayudaba para aprender y posteriormente tener un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Talleristas del Nuevo Amanecer” is in its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Lourdes serves as the secretary. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling skirts, selling vests, and selling jackets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Lourdes. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from the organization through a mass promotion that was being conducted in her area. Lourdes currently has a sewing business where she produces traditional skirts. She is knowledgeable about this business since she learned the trade from her sister who was in the same line of work. Lourdes learned the business by helping her and later started an independent business of her own.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabrics in bulk. She acquires her supplies from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then uses them in her production. Her products are sold from her retail space. Working in his manner allows her to generate income for supporting her family. Lourdes is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lourdes said that she enjoys the training seminars that are offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Juana Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta deaccesorios para carros,la socia por medio de este negocio quere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ventanas,parabrisas y llantas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Elizabeth continues to make a living selling car accessories. Juana uses this business to support her family, she dreams of expanding her car accessory business in the future. 

Juana is seeking a loan to buy windows, windscreens and tires.She is very happy with the loan and is committed to making the regular repayments.

loans.use: to buy windows, windscreens and tires.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras,arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Erika, the member, continues to work in food sales. Through this business she wants to help her family get ahead. Her dream is to own a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with loan payments.

loans.use: buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,la socia prepara sandwichs,jugos,empanadas y pasteles,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tortas,empanadas y pasteles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Marcelina continues to run her coffee shop. She prepares sandwiches, juices, empanadas and cakes. With this business she supports her family. She is requesting the loan to buy cakes, empanadas and pastries. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cakes, empanadas and pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on charcoal

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr:
Florentine a 49 ans. Elle est veuve et elle a deux enfants à sa charge. Le dernier qui a 12 ans va à l'école actuellement et en classe de 6ème. Quant à l'ainée, elle aide sa mère dans l'exercice de son activité et dans leur ménage.
Florentine a une petite épicerie, elle a démarré en 2010. C'est une femme battante, son désir est de pouvoir continuer à lutter et avancer dans la vie. Elle ne baisse jamais les bras même si elle est seule à assumer ses responsabilités et ses devoirs.
Sa demande de crédit a pour objet d'augmenter et diversifier les stocks de marchandises pour compléter les achalandages afin d'attirer des clients.
Son rêve est ainsi de pouvoir réaménager et réhabiliter son lieu de vente.
texts.en: Florentine is 49 years old and a widow. She has two children to support. The youngest is 12 years old and goes to school presently in the 6th grade. As for the oldest, she helps her mother operate her business in their home. Florentine has a small grocery store. She started off in 2010. She is a determined woman. Her desire is to be able to continue in her struggle and advance in life. She never rests, even if she is alone in assuming her responsibilities and chores. The purpose of her loan request is to increase her stock of merchandise and diversify it, so as to attract customers. Her dream is therefore to reorganize her sales location and to renovate it.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar, salt, cookies, and pasta

loans.name: Cesiri N°2 Group

texts.fr:
l’homme qui tend l’aliment bétail aux bœufs sur la photo est Abdoulaye
Abdoulaye est un malien. Il a été à l’école. Son niveau est la 4è année fondamentale. Abdoulaye est âgé de 52 ans. Marié, sa femme est une ménagère. Père de 3 enfants dont 1 garçon et 2 filles. Les 2 enfants filles et garçon ne sont pas scolarisés et une est à l’école coranique. Cultivateur, il cultive le riz, le mil (sorgho et petit mil), arachide, …etc..
 Il prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des bœufs pour l’embouche. Il fait ses achats aux marchés locaux. Après l’engraissement il les revend  chez lui-même. Le bénéfice reçu sur la vente des bœufs lui permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants. Il déclare n’avoir pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. son rêve pour l’avenir c’est avoir un prêt conséquent pour acheter assez de bœufs pour l’élevage et faciliter l’agriculture afin de satisfaire suffisamment à mes besoins et ceux de ma famille.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is the man holding feed for the cattle in the photo. He is Malian and has attended school to the 4th grade. He is 52 years old and married, and his wife is a homemaker. He is the father of three children (a boy and two girls). The two daughters and son are not in school, and one is learning the Koran. A farmer, Abdoulaye grows rice, millet, sorghum, pearl millet, peanuts, … etc. He is taking out a loan at RMCR to purchase some cattle to fatten. He makes his purchases at local markets. 

After fattening the cattle, he resells them himself. The profits from the sales enable him to cover his expenses: healthcare, food, and clothing for the children. He states that he has had no problem with borrowing from RMCR. 

For the future, his dream is to have a loan for buying enough cattle to raise and for facilitating farming, so as to meet his needs and those of his family adequately.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then resell

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 43 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than twenty years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Everlyne is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by eleven farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Everlyne started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Everlyne’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap, 45, is a potato and rice farmer and worker on another farm, living in Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of five children, who are all dependent on her, and three of them are in school. She has been involved in her current businesses for 12 years and earns about USD 16.67 per day.

Due to lack of funds to do the farming, she is now applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee. She wishes to gain more yields and be able to buy more farmland to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,la socia vende faroles,parabrisas entre otros,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar faros,espejos,llantas y parabrisas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues in the business of selling auto parts for cars. She sells headlights and windshields among other items. The member is an enterprising and hard-working woman who wants to help her family get ahead through this business. She is requesting a loan to buy headlights, mirrors, tires and windshields.

The member is happy for this loan and promises to comply with the terms of the loan.

loans.use: buy headlights, mirrors, tires and a windshield.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, realiza esta actividad desde hace 18 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas como son tablas, burros, etc. para implementar su negocio esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará sus ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 38 years old and lives with his partner and two children in their own home. They live in a community dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock in a rural area of the Oyotún district in the Chicalayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He works as a day laborer in agriculture. He has been doing this for 18 yeas, which is how he has gained a lot of experience in the business as well as good personal and work references in the district. He is requesting a loan to buy tools such as tables and donkeys to outfit his business. In this way he can provide better service to his clients, which will increase his income and improve his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy tools like tables and donkeys to outfit his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a glass showcase and used fridge in good shape and at a good price.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jinky is 41 years old and both of her children are presently in school.

Jinky has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jinky has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores está casada, tiene 48 años, el esposo tiene 45 años viven con sus hijos en el sector de San Roque de Antonio Ante ellos viven desde hace 23 años por el sector, el lugar es conocido por sus artesanías indígenas como las camisas bordadas a mano, fajas de indígenas y otros productos que hacen a mano y las ofrecen en mercado de la ciudad en el lugar hay turismo como el volcán de Imbabura que muchos turistas llegan a visitar.
Dolores, tiene su criadero de chancos en el domicilio y también realiza el comercio de las mismas ella ya viene realizando desde hace años la actividad aprendió por los familiares que también se dedican a esta actividad, desde pequeños ellos han vivido en el sector rural y también por esa parte ellos han aprendió a como criar animales y comercializarlos en los mercados de la ciudad de donde ellos viven, Dolores tiene más ideas para seguir haciendo crecer más negocio familiar que mantiene hoy en día.
En el hogar el esposo le ayuda a ofrecer los animales a sus conocidos trabajan conjuntamente se ayudan todos y es como así el negocio sigue manteniendo un ritmo bueno y siguen incrementando más clientes y así están ofreciendo lo mejor en el hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de  más cerdos y también en materiales de construcción para un lugar de mayor seguridad en donde no se salgan los animales a la calle  y evitar  así que sean robados.
texts.en:
Dolores is 48 years old and married. Her husband is 45 years old and they live with their children in the neighborhood of San Roque de Antonio. They have lived in this area for 23 years. This place is known for its indigenous handicrafts such as hand-embroidered shirts, traditional skirts, and other handmade products that are offered at the city market. Many tourists come to visit this area since there are attractions such as the volcano at Imbabura.

Dolores raises pigs at her home and also sells them. She has been doing this for years and learned the trade from relatives who were in the same line of work. Those who live in rural areas learned how to raise animals at a young age and then sell them at the local markets. Dolores has ideas of how to keep growing the family business that she has maintained to this day.

At home, her husband helps by offering the animals to acquaintances with whom he has working relationships. Everyone keeps the business running on a regular routine so that they can keep gaining more customers and offering the best products from their home.

The loan Dolores is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more pigs and also materials for building a space that is more secure and will prevent the animals from running into the street and getting stolen.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and materials for building a space where the animals will be kept.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 35 лет, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Динары среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством и торговлей продуктами питания в собственном павильоне. Свою деятельность Динара начала в 1995 году, у нее очень хороший опыт. В магазине есть товар на сумму 260,000 сом (KGS), в хозяйстве  - корова и 1,0 Га арендованной земли, где Динара выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход от торговли и сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет 65,000 сом (KGS), Динара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на открытие собственного швейного цеха, на полученные средства она приобретет швейные, оверлочные машины и специализированный утюг. Динара давно мечтала начать швейный бизнес, она хочет увеличить семейные доходы и откладывать на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Dinara is 35 years old.  She and her husband are raising three children.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in agriculture and she also sells food products in her own kiosk, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started her activity is 1995 and she has a good deal of experience.  Dinara has 260,000 som (KGS) worth of merchandise in her shop and her farm comprises one cow and one hectare of rented land on which she grows barley for resale.  She makes a monthly gross income from trade and business activities of 65,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to open her own sewing shop.  She will use her loan to buy sewing machines, overlock machines and a special iron.  Dinara has been dreaming about opening her own sewing business for a long time.  Her goal is to increase her family's income and to save some money toward her children's education.

loans.use: to start her own sewing business by purchasing sewing machines, overlock machines and a special iron.

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es:
Iris, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de pan francés, tiene tres hijos que asisten a la escuela y viven con ella.

Iris, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés, ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 10 años, aprendió a hacer pan en un curso que estudio de panadería, tiempo después se involucró su esposo y su madre, ella sale a vender pan en su carro.

Iris, solicita el crédito para ampliar su panadería y comprar insumos para la elaboración del pan.

El sueño de Iris, es tener un horno más grande y generar empleo para otra persona.
texts.en: Iris is 32 years old. She attended school until ninth grade. She is married. Her husband works making French bread. She has three children, who go to school and live with her. Iris works making and selling French bread. She has worked in this business for 10 years, and she learned how to make bread after taking a bread baking class. Shortly after, she involved her husband and her mother in the business. She sells bread from her cart. Iris is requesting the loan to expand her bakery and buy inputs to make bread. Iris's dream is to have a bigger oven and to generate employment for another person.

loans.use: to expand her bakery and buy inputs to make bread.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está en su ciclo número 21, cada una esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cinthia.
Ella vende prendas de todo tipo de manera ambulante, y ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y gracias a su lucha y esfuerzo está creciendo y saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Cinthia está poniendo todo de sí, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, remeras y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) is in its 21st loan cycle. Each member is giving her best effort to grow and move forward. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Cinthia. She sells all types of clothes as a street vendor and has established a very good clientele. Thanks to her determination and effort, she has been able to grow and succeed. Cinthia is a self-sacrificing and determined individual.

She is giving her all and is requesting a loan in order to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, and other items so that she can continue her sales just as before. Cinthia appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue striving on behalf of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la caficultora desde hace 6 años inicio cultivando 500 plantas y así es como ha ido aumento la producción del cultivo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para poder tener una mejor cosecha de café mas productiva y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Julio lives in his own home with his family. He earns his living growing coffee. He began growing coffee with 500 plants six years ago, which is how he has increased crop production. He sells his products in different markets that are close to his home. With his earnings, he covers some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides, manure, pest control, and more to have a better, more productive harvest and, therefore, earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for his coffee production

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Marta de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad agrícola, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder aumentar el rendimiento de los cultivos y tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She earns her living cultivating corn and sorghum. She has done this farming work for more than 10 years. She sells her products in different markets that are close to her home. Thanks to her sales she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, pest control, and more to be able to increase crop yields and have higher profits to put towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for corn and sorghum

loans.name: Roberto Noe

texts.es: Roberto de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Él se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace tres años . Roberto desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda está solicitando un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para levantar un muro y proteger su casa que con mucho esfuerzo ha construido ya que en tiempo de lluvia se cae la tierra a un costado de su casa, el invertirá el crédito en la compra de arena, cemento, hierro y ladrillos para construir un muro en su vivienda. Con mucho esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su esposa construyeron su casa de ladrillos de barro la cual con el crédito que obtuvieron anteriormente de la institución, pudieron reparar el techo de la misma y construir una pared divisora de los cuartos, Roberto ha mostrado ser responsable al pagar puntualmente las cuotas de su crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Roberto, 47 years old, lives with his partner and two children in a home they own. He has been selling bread for three years. He wants to build a retaining wall in his home. He is requesting a new loan through Kiva partner FUSAI to erect a wall to protect his house, which he built through much effort. In the rainy season, the ground washes away on one side of the house.

He will use the loan to buy sand, cement, iron and bricks to build the new wall in his home. He built his house of mud bricks with much effort and the help of his spouse, along with the loan he initially received from the institution. With those same loan proceeds, they were also able to repair the ceiling and build a wall to divide rooms.

Roberto has shown himself to be responsible in making loan payments.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, iron and bricks to build a wall in his home.

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es: Neris es una mujer comerciante de una tienda de ropa usada, su único apoyo ha sido su esposo. Ella agradece a Kiva y MiCrédito ya que gracias a los créditos brindados ha podido invertir en la compra de más ropa usada para su tienda. Ella solicita el crédito, una vez más, para volver a invertir en mercadería y comprar nuevos estilos de ropa para sus clientes para así tener mejores ingresos. Sus planes son seguir adquiriendo créditos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Neris is a wholesaler in a second-hand clothing store. Her only support has been her spouse.  Thanks to Kiva and MiCrédito, she has been able to invest in more used clothing for her store. She is requesting another loan to invest in merchandise and buy new styles of clothing for her clients in order to increase her income. Her plan is to continue acquiring loans to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy new styles of clothing for her clients.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijo en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pollos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto ella espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and son in a community devoted to commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry, located at the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú.
She works raising and selling small animals such as hens, ducks, chickens, turkeys, among others. She has worked in this business for more than 10 years. Her business is located in her home. Additionally, she works in the mototaxi rental. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of animals and balanced feed to fatten these. With it, she hopes to offer her customers a larger variety of animals, which will allow her to improve her sales and in this way, to improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals and balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Julia Carolina

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene 1 año de experiencia inicio con capital propio por falta de empleo, con las ventas que realiza es como ha logrado salir adelante, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa y cosméticos (perfumes, cremas, lociones, etc.) para poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young woman has her face pixelated because she is 19 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She sells clothing and cosmetics. She has a year of experience beginning with her own money because of her lack of employment. Her sales allow her to get ahead. She is a single mother and lives in her own house. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics like perfumes, lotions, and more in order to have better profits and give her son a better life.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Manos Unidas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 17 se encuentran mejorando su situación de la pobreza, por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Todas se están capacitando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias, entre las que se destaca la Sra. Gasparina, quien es costurera, hace todo tipo de confecciones, con los que puede ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Quiere tener algún día un gran taller de costura para poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Manos Unidas” (United Hands) has taken the poverty elimination survey. There are 17 members who have improved their poverty situation as a result of their participation in the poverty elimination program.

Everyone is receiving training and striving to improve the living conditions for themselves and their families. One member who should be mentioned is Sra. Gasparina. She works as a seamstress and produces all types of handmade products so that she can help her family and loved ones. Someday she would like to have a large sewing workshop so that she can continue her work just as before.

Gasparina is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, and other supplies so that she can continue sewing as always. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue her work as normal.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es: Rogelio de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) y a realizar trabajos de albañilería, tiene 29 años de experiencia el cual inicio con capital propio, saca sus cosechas de diciembre a marzo y las vende en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, Rogelio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y el pago de alquiler de la parcela ya que no cuenta con terreno propio y así poder tener una mejor cosecha para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 61, lives in his own house with his family. He earns his living cultivating basic grains like corn and beans and doing masonry work. He has 29 years of experience in business, which he began with his own capital. He reaps his harvest December through March and sells in agencies that buy and sell basic grains. 

Rogelio is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, and to pay for land to rent because he does not have his own farmland in order to have a better harvest and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to grow corn and beans

loans.name: Cristina Santos

texts.es:
La señora  Cristina  de 36  años de edad  es casada y vive  en su casa de habitación con su esposo se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 12 años ella también cría cerdos, ella ordeña el ganado y luego vende la leche, sus clientes le visitan en su casa de habitación, es conocida por ser una joven muy luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comprar algunas reses, radica en aldea la Cuesta al sur de Honduras.
Cristina está solicitando 15, 000.00 lempiras para compra de pasto y concentrado para su ganado. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  cristina desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos. 
Cristina su sueño es seguir creciendo más en su pequeña hacienda y tener mucho mas ganado para tener una mejor vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old. She is married and lives in her home with her husband. She has been raising livestock for the last 12 years, and she also raises pigs. She also milks cows and sells the milk. Her customers come to her home. 

She is known as a very determined young woman who with great effort has managed to buy some cattle. She lives in the village of Cuesta in southern Honduras.

 Cristina is requesting 15,000.00 lempiras to buy grass and concentrated feed for her livestock. With her earnings and the support from this loan, Cristina hopes to get ahead and have a better life. 

Cristina's dream is of for her small farm to keep growing and to have much more livestock in order to have a better life. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2015

loans.use: to buy grass and concentrated feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Jefsy Jane

texts.en:
Jefsy Jane works hard to support her family. Jefsy Jane is married and has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines.

Jefsy Jane requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more oysters, shrimp, mussels, and other seafood to sell.

Jefsy Jane has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more oysters, shrimp, mussels, and other seafoods to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and married with three children. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to  buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Galo Bolivar

texts.es: Galo tiene 36 años de edad es soltero vive en guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Mantilla, el se dedica a la venta de borregos y solicita el credito para comprar mas animales para incrementar su negocio, realiza las compras en guaranda cada semana, su sueño es conseguir un trabajo fijo. En su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en: Galo is 36 years old, is single, and lives in Guaranda, province of Bolivar, in the community of Mantilla. He makes a living by selling sheep and he is asking for the loan to buy more animals to increase his business. He makes purchases in Guaranda each week. His dream is to get fixed work. In his free time, he likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en: Mireille is 33 years old. She is married with three children aged between 7 and 13 years. They all go to school. She owns a bar and she has been in business for the past 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more beer for resale

loans.name: Zuly Maritza

texts.es:
Zuly es una joven de 27 años que a pesar de no tener mucha edad cuenta con mucha madurez, responsabilidad y tolerancia para afrontar un problema, ella una madre de 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 4 que se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino y el levanto de pollos, está actividad para ella ha sido una bendición en partea que gracias a la utilidad puede mantener su hogar, pagar la renta, la escuela de sus hijos, los servicios públicos y por tener el negocio en casa está muy pendiente de su crecimiento puesto que una persona como ella no tiene el capital para pagar una niñera que este siempre pendiente de ellos.
 
Su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda para vivir feliz junto a sus hijos, tener algo seguro que dejarle cuando ella pueda faltar, todo esto en base a su negocio que se ha convertido casi que en su vida, por ello busca mejorar sus ventas, tener mayor número de clientes.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer sus galpones y cocheras, comprara cerdos y pollos.
texts.en:
Zuly is a young woman of 27 who is spite of her youth has great maturity, responsibility, and tolerance for facing a problem. She is the mother of three children, ages 10, 8, and 4, and she works in raising pigs and chickens. For her, this activity has been a blessing, in part because thanks to the profits she can maintain her household and pay the rent, the children's school expenses, and the public services. Because she has the business in her home, she is very attentive to the development of her children, since a person such as herself doesn't have the capital to pay for a babysitter to always look after them.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house where she can live happily with her children and to have something certain to leave them in case she's no longer around. All this is based on her business, which has almost become her life. For this reason, she seeks to improve her sales and have a greater number of customers.

She wants to apply for a loan to stock the sheds and pens by buying pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to stock her sheds and pens by buying pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Everlyne is representing her group of 15 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Everlyne has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Everlyne is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6 acres will be planted by Everlyne's Group, and among them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a 35-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Veronica has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Veronica described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Veronica’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Maly is 30 years old and living in Battambang province. She is a married mother of four children, and two of them are in school while the others are too young to go to school. Nowadays, she grows potatoes on 2 hectares of farmland, and her husband is a policeman. She could earn about 53,300 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading her group to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay the plowing fee. Through this loan, she hopes that she could earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en: Khem’s group live in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Khem makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these persons to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Molika's Group

texts.en:
Molika, 28, is a married mother of a child, living in Battambang province. To earn her family’s living, she has grown sesame for fifteen years and sells sour fruit which provides her about 66,000 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now forming a group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

Molika will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to earn more money and have the ability to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS están en el 4to. ciclo con 14 integrantes, estas son mujeres de zonas rurales trabajadoras y con ganas de superación, ellas quieren ir superándose por medio de su esfuerzo y lucha diaria.
Una de las integrantes la señora Luciana se dedica a la artesanía, el préstamo que pide lo quiere invertir en la compra de lanas, para que ella pueda seguir con la elaboración de sus artesanías.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo bastante unido, con  la  plena convicción de trabajar todas juntas, apoyándose mutuamente en pos de fortalecer la vida de cada una y así facilitar una mejor calidad de vida para sí mismas como para sus familias.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is in its fourth loan cycle with 14 members. These rural women are hard workers who have the drive to succeed. They want to excel through their efforts and strive each day.

One of the members is Sra. Luciana, who makes handicrafts. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase in wool so that she can continue making her handicrafts.

The members have formed a unified group that is fully committed to working together and mutually supporting one another in the pursuit of strengthening their lives so that they can facilitate a better quality of life for themselves as well as their families.

loans.use: to buy wool for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Delina Group

texts.en:
Claudius is a married man and a father of four grown children. He is aged 50 years old, and currently has been running a store selling soft drinks and spirits for six years. He is also involved with raising animals for sale. Claudius starts working from 06 pm to midnight every day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is his first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Delina, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Claudius will invest his portion of this credit to buy drinks: beers, sodas, juices, water and spirits. He dreams of improving his animal-raising business (to raise pigs, cows and chickens for sale).

loans.use: to buy drinks: beers, sodas, juices, water and spirits for resale.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 42 years old, married and has a child. He is married to a public school teacher. 

To acquire income and sustain his family's needs, Domingo operates a store and distributes cases of soft-drinks to nearby stores in their village. Domingo wants to keep increasing his sales so he needs to increase his merchandise too. 

Therefore, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy cases of soft-drinks and grocery items (canned goods, breads, noodles) to sell. 

Domingo will achieve financial stability someday by maintaining a good flow of his business. He will also save additional revenue for his family's future expenses. 

Domingo is wearing a white shirt, and beside him is the Branch Manager validating his business.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft-drinks and grocery items (canned goods, breads, noodles) to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susana has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Susana would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosa dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and has two children who are in school. Elsie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Elsie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 47 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Ma. Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, diapers, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emerine

texts.en:
Emerine is 30 years old. She is married with three children aged between one and nine years. One of them goes to school. 

Emerine sells clothes and she has been in business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more scarves, T-shirts and trousers to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more scarves, T-shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and she is representing her group of 9 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jane has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jane described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kilwake's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Kilwake, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to two children. She is known by her community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Kilwake joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Kilwake plans to repair her home.

Among the 14 farmers in Kilwake's Group, a total of 6.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Catherine is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Catherine started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has gained a lot of respect in her community ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Catherine’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children between 1 and 8 years old. One of them goes to school. 

She sells domestic animals and she has been in business for the past 2 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house and improve her savings.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats to resell.

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
Benjamin, pictured above, is a group leader representing his group, formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. Benjamin joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Benjamin will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours, thereby enabling his children to study. Benjamin plans to use the profits he gains this year to continue sending his children to school.

In total, Benjamin’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Jane has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jane described her harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus) last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sorphea's Group

texts.en:
Sorphea is a resident of Bovel district of Battambang province. She is 51 years old and a mother of two school-age children. 

To support her family’s living, she grows potatoes and works for another farm for additional income, and she has been involved in this business for ten years and it earns her about 44,000 KHR daily. 

Now her family faces a problem because she has not enough funds to do the farm. So she decided to lead a group to access a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a portion to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for plowing costs. 

She hopes to earn more money and buy additional farmland for doing farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for plowing costs

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon’s group members live in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Samon makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to diversify her business by adding cosmetics

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, 35, lives in a small community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He is a father of five children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural produce to local dealers. So far, he is has been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Quang, a 54-year-old married father of two, lives and works in Dong Son district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. He has been raising poultry and cattle for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Quang faces is not having a hygienic latrine. He is therefore requesting his first loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

Quang hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Leab lives in a community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of six children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Excequiel

texts.es:
Excequiel tiene 70 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, desde hace 11 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de un torete para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Excequiel is 70 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Callayuc, a community that dedicates itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It's located in the Cutervo province, which is part of the Cajamarca region on Peru's northern coast.

He has worked  in raising and selling cattle for 11 years, and his wife helps him with that task. He's experienced in this business and has good personal and work references in the district. He's requesting a loan to purchase a young bull to subsequently fatten and sell for a higher price, thus generating more income for his family, which will provide a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a young bull to subsequently fatten and sell at a higher price

loans.name: Natik

texts.en:
Natik is 37 years old and comes from Gardabani district. He has a wife and three children and is the only breadwinner in the family. As Natik was unable to start any stable job, he started up a private business, particularly making furniture for sale. He gets private orders from local people, however, his income isn't stable and Natik requires an additional source to provide financial stability for his family.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Natik applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting poor people to start or re-start businesses. He decided to purchase a second-hand car and start providing taxi service during his free time. 

Natik will serve local people and get significant income that will help him to meet all family expenses more effectively. He  is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to ensure his children of a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Natik is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start providing taxi service

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is 60 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Arcelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arcelita has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arcelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en:
Veronique is 33 years old. She is married with one child, four years old. Her child does not yet go to school.
